Reviews.Title: “A ex-vancouverite's recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Ryan S
Reviews.Content: The location is an ideal jumping off point to some of the more interesting sites in Vancouver: Kitsilano, Jericho Beach, The Endowment Lands and Robson Street. The hotel provides some wonderful views of the harbour and the rooms are modern and clean. Oh, and Granville Island is one of the great treasures of Vancouver that residents regularly flock to and no tourist should miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Getaway”
Reviews.Author: cwaitesSorrento2010
Reviews.Content: My partner and I enjoy staying at this hotel. Its location beside the seawall is ideal and all rooms have a nice harbour view. Restaurants and the Granville Market are within walking distance as well as many theatres and artisans. We travel to Vancouver on business trips and always extend our stay a day or two to enjoy the ambience of this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Granny-Mae
Reviews.Content: For the vacation traveller this location hits the spot. Very central with markets, food stalls, shopping and galleries at your doorstep. Breakfast from the fresh food markets with real coffee from a real coffee machine. Yumm. Bus stop at the entrance to the island, the cute little ferries take you down town or a walk over Granville Bridge is not a huge impost. There are several pubs on the island to have a drink after a days sightseeing. Most offer good meals. We ate in the Granvile on two nights, once in the dining and once in the bar area. Both menus are the same and both times we had a good meal. The room was modern and spacious. We liked that you could open the winow and let the fresh air roll in. Staff were helpful at every turn. The free high speed wifi was a bonus. We loved this boutique style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent overall experience”
Reviews.Author: Carla R
Reviews.Content: This is a charming, quiet, conveniently (re centrally located) hotel in the heart of Vancouver. The staff were kind and responsive, the rooms clean, and the food, in general, excellent (with a few hiccups that we promptly resolved) - all a traveler would want in overnight lodging. The business centre is clean and up-to-date, and the printing free. No charges for internet, no hidden irritating extras expenses - what you see is what you get and that is much appreciated. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Simon T
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me and I was very impressed. the rooms were well appointed and modern. The resuarant was excellent but lets face it, it's location, location, location. What a wonderful spot. I will be returning. The only change I would make is a better equiped fitness centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: ugogirl7
Reviews.Content: I don't usually stay in upscale hotels because cheaper hotels (if carefully chosen) offer far better value for money and because I don't care for the usual obsequious staff, dripping venom. Sensitive of me, but there you go. This time was, however, a business trip and I had no choice. Happily, the Granville Island Hotel was different. The room was nice enough and everything was clean. The coffee pot didn't work but was exchanged promptly. The Docksider Restaurant was okay, too. Surprisingly, the best thing was the hotel staff. Very pleasant, friendly and accommodating. Not a sign of venom. I liked them and they didn't seem to dislike me. Perfect. I've stayed at a lot of hotels in Vancouver and elsewhere, both up and downscale, and this one was good. The location is wonderful and we loved the views of False Creek.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, great experience”
Reviews.Author: NitpickerCaroline
Reviews.Content: In Vancouver for business, we wanted a boutique-type hotel, something with some personality. We loved the Granville Island Hotel. Clean and quiet, superb restaurant on the premises, great access to downtown and fabulous artsy island to explore. Staff were very friendly and genuinely interested in our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Adelle58
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in March. We ususally stay on English Bay when we visit Vancouver, so this was very different for us. Loved being on Granville Island. There are lots of great pathways for running. Tons of restaurants and shopping very close by. The hotel itself was clean, staff friendly, great restaurant and lounge that we used several times. The view of false creek from the dining room/lounge was really lovely. Our room, although a king-sized bed, was directly over the front entry-way, so it was a bit noisey in the early morning when the local running group met at 7:30 for their Saturday run. That being said, the hotel gave us the corporate rate even though the course that I was registered for was cancelled, which was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Location both a huge plus and a minor minus”
Reviews.Author: winst0n4
Reviews.Content: The Granville Island proved to be a pleasant and convenient hotel in the middle of one of Vancouver's principal tourist havens. The Island is charming, but one can never forget that its priority is tourism, tourism, tourism. And, if you are in Vancouver for business, you should not forget that the Island and thus the hotel are rather distant from downtown, and even from attractions like the Vancouver Art Gallery. But the food at the hotel is quite decent, the rooms have very good views, and they are well appointed. I was surprised that the hotel did not provide a bathrobe, but that was not a great inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing restaurant and service!”
Reviews.Author: 1annette71
Reviews.Content: We are a 40-something couple travelling with 3 small children. Since we'd heard that the rooms can vary in size and view, we requested (at booking) a larger room and a nice view, both of which were accommodated by the hotel. The highlight was the restaurant, which had the best food on the island and quite possibly in all of Vancouver's westside. Unbelievable. My husband tried a different beer each night that was micro-brewed at the hotel. He was very impressed and requested a tour of the brewery, which the brew-master provided for him. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The walls were thick and the hotel had a quiet but friendly feel to it. Our girls loved the decent-sized hot tube with the windowed ceiling that allowed us to watch the starts at night. The location was ideal and the staff were superb. What would have made this hotel a 5-star for us would have been if the concierge had been more knowledgeable, particularly with transit options for exploring attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fab boutique hotel, great food & views at Dockside Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: SusieQpacific
Reviews.Content: I have lots of out of town guests stay here, have attended many functions here...it's simply a consistently excellent boutique hotel with great service and a can't beat location. It's anchored by Dockside Restaurant which has a fantastic menu and vantage point with a sprawling outside patio that looks like a movie set. A shaded grass area to tie your dog is the topper. Love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Granville Island Hotel overnighter”
Reviews.Author: SueParsons
Reviews.Content: First, I need to mention how helpful the folks at the front desk were. They know their facility well and strive to make their guests comfortable. My feeling was that they would never make me feel as though any question I asked were silly. In addition, when my family and I arrived early, they gave us a parking pass well before check-in time. It's those kinds of perks which make people decide to return. My room - 316. Oh, my gosh. That view is killer, and with two decks with which to view it! I wish that there were a way to turn off the outside lights, however, so that I could leave the curtains open at night to catch the lights from the buildings across False Creek. I will totally ask for that room again. Go to the adjoining restaurant - Docksider - for at least one meal. Awesome food, service and view!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous experience.. in one of the greatest places in Vancouver !”
Reviews.Author: Brad021312
Reviews.Content: One of the best places I have ever stayed. Sales Manager Christine was wonderful to deal with, and very accomodating in helping us put together a stay package with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: Kate M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my boyfriends birthday and I purchase a coupon from WagJag. It was an absolutely fantastic experience! Upon check-in we received maps of Vancouver and Granville Island and the staff suggested where to go and spend the nice sunny day. All great places! We had lunch and breakfast the next day at the Dockside restaurant and it was delicious! Great service. Our room was spacious and very clean with a nice new tv and great view! After I informed the staff that it was for a birthday they brought a lovely bottle of red wine to our room with nice glasses. It was a wonderful time and I would highly recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch?”
Reviews.Author: mamatross
Reviews.Content: We live in this city and enjoy Granville Island. When a fire forced us out of our home, I called the Granville Island Hotel and asked their rate for one night. It was evening and the fellow at the desk said he "could do $149". We took the room, and the next morning I called down to the desk and asked if we could stay in this room another night at the same rate. The answer was yes. When we checked out we signed the credit card bill and were off. However, when we got home,I looked at the bill and realized we were overcharged. $169 and $179. I called to straighten this out and spoke to Kim, the manager on duty. We went back and forth for a while, but I gave in when she told me "Impossible. We have no rate ever of $149". I swallowed the new rate and felt she thought I was trying to pull a fast one. I was so upset with the fire, maybe I had made the mistake. We could still not return to our home and since the location was best for us, we called to book in for a few more nights. The woman at the desk easily offered a room for $149 the first night, and a bit higher subsequent nights. I took this but had her email the confirmation this time. My mind was on dealing with the restoration of our home , not the rate of this hotel, so I let this go at the time. When I received an email asking me to write a review for Trip Advisor, I phoned the gal and told her why I was unhappy before i wrote this. Christine sympathized but did not adjust the rate. She said she would send us a free dinner coupon to make up for our troubles. I declined, saying that was not the reason I had phoned. She insisted she attempt to make it up to us. Never received the dinner coupon! Had this not happened, my review would say nice hotel, but beware there are huge differences in the rooms here. There are some that look down on huge vats, which I gather produce beer, and the hum of these kept me up all one night. One night our room was spacious, another room was quite cramped. If you must book here, get your rate emailed to you to ensure you check out with the same rate. There are too many wonderful hotels in Vancouver to choose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: thetraveldoc
Reviews.Content: Arrived to an over-heated tiny room that was dark. No place to put carry on luggage so left it on 2nd bed. View of a deck for ventilation shafts. Bathroom appeared clean, modern, renovated. But how much time could I spend in the loo? Breakfast was memorably disappointing. Couldn't find the shrimp in my omellette. Pieces smaller than ants were under the lettuce. None in the omellete. Had to pay 3$ on top of the 17$ for toast with the omellette. Lunch was quite good, with a friendly efficient waiter compared to the ornery one who "served" breakfast. No offer of extra coffee refill, water, etc. In brief, this "boutique" hotel makes rooms at a Holiday Inn Select or Delta look like a 5* palace. Avoid this place, especially if you want to appreciate this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canukgurl
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here and were not dissapointed. Friendly, clean, quiet...what more can you ask for? Right in the heart of Granville Island to make it really easy to explore. Great views of False Creek. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Regular Visitor”
Reviews.Author: Rugby59
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel on a regular basis for a number of years and continue to really enjoy the experience. The location, for me, is ideal, the reception very friendly and efficient and the rooms great value for the price. As I live in the UK I almost regard the hotel as my second home!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Mary U
Reviews.Content: A clean, comfortable, convenient and scenic place to stay for visitors to Vancouver. Hop on a nearby ferry to explore downtown, the West End, Yaletown or Chinatown. Visit all the amenities on Granville island and enjoy a meal at the hotel restaurant Dockside - especially on the waterside plaza in the summer! Even though we're local, we've stayed here a few times when we've turned our place over to out-of-town family.

Reviews.Title: “Bustling by Day, Quiet by Night”
Reviews.Author: iceman43c
Reviews.Content: One of my favourite weekend retreats. The hotel is located on Granville Island in the heart of Vancouver. Granville Island is a shoppers bazaar by day for gifts, clothing, groceries, baked goods, quick snacks, sophisticated dining, aboriginal art and more and also popular among locals and tourists alike. Being on the water, there is never a lack of things to do or see. At night there is live theatre and great dining both on the island as well as a short drive or cab ride away. The evenings are quiet and perfect for a good nights sleep. Living in the 'burbs' of Vancouver, my wife and I enjoy staying at the Granville Island Hotel as our home away from home. It allows us to enjoy the Vancouver night life without the drive back home in the early morning hours. We find the hotel rooms well appointed and comfortable; the staff friendly and accomodating. The dining room in the hotel is the Dockside Restaurant which offers a fine menu for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. On the weekend, we especially enjoy items on the brunch menu. We have on occasion had many out of town guests attend a celebration or reunion and have not hesitated to recommend the Granville Island Hotel for their stay in Vancouver. The Granville Island Hotel continues to be one of our favourites.

Reviews.Title: “Would be 3 stars but for the location”
Reviews.Author: pherriswheel
Reviews.Content: The Granville Island hotel is clean, comfortable and very normal as a regular hotel. They do seem to lean a bit too heavily on their location, and although their beds are comfy and bathrooms fresh, the rest of the room decor needs sprucing up. The staff were pleasant but not friendly, it felt more like an anonymous business hotel than a friendly holiday venue. If you're after quiet halls, comfy bed, perfect location and restrained staff attitudes, this is your spot. However, we had just come from a Kimpton in Seattle, and the energy, friendliness, perks, and decor of the Kimpton made the Granville seem boring and drab. If we'd come to it from a long flight or a stressful meeting we may have liked it better. However we were on holiday and would have appreciated a more friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely spot right on the water”
Reviews.Author: kerryharrismail
Reviews.Content: Quiet and cozy, this hotel is perfect for exploring Vancouver -- well appointed rooms and great bar and restaurant right on the water make for a well appointed stay. Friendly staff and lovely rooms, this hotel is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly above average”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravellers2008
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 4-5 times in the past 4 years and I'm only so-so on this place. Pros: location is good (not near downtown though), walking distance to the food markets, restaurant in hotel has great food and views of the water Cons: internet is an adventure, rooms are so very small, front desk staff only somewhat helpful instead seeming to believe you should be just happy to be there, rooms and general decor definitely need an upgrade/overhaul, fitness centre is painfully bad (just admit you don't have one), definitely the slowest elevator in Vancouver (and only one elevator).

Reviews.Title: “Granville Island Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan B
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth Christmas getaway at the hotel. We're locals, but spend Christmas at the hotel each year, with our 3 (large) dogs and cat. The staff are friendly, helpful and always pleased to see us. The rooms are large, each with a small balcony and most have a view of the water. The food is excellent ( both room service and in the resto) and they have a micro brewery on site. With the hectic run up to Christmas ( I usually end up having to work right up to about 3 on the 24th), the arrival at the hotel is usually accompanied by a deep sigh... we're home!

Reviews.Title: “Great area and hotel is lovely!”
Reviews.Author: kjwebb1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here frequently and will continue to do so when I travel to Vancouver! The hotel is very good, with decent sized rooms, great prices and excellent service! I love the lounge and the micro brew beer! The area is amazing with lots of shopping, great food and beautiful views! And the best part is- it's dog friendly! My mutt loves Granville Island! Thanks again for a great Vacouver visit!

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but great”
Reviews.Author: parrot101
Reviews.Content: It is a mash up of 80s smoked glass and more recent upgrades and pseudo renovations. Sounds terrible but its not. Big rooms with lots of windows. Right on the water. My 8 year old could throw a rock into the water from our room but might hit one of the dozens of boats bobbing outside our window. Big clean remodelled bathroom. 3 balconies. we have a superior room but the view and location can't be beat. on location - it is not downtown but across the water. take waterbus for a few dollars and go where you like. Food isnt great but you are right by the market. it is a getaway in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: Farleywoof
Reviews.Content: Granville Island is a wonderful oasis of calm right in the middle of Vancouver, there are shops, restaurants and sights all around. The Hotel is excellent and they go all the way to make their guests comfortable. They also have pet friendly rooms with tiled floors. Perfect

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel by Granville Island and the West Side”
Reviews.Author: grantfromVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Granville Island Hotel because it was close to the Stanley Theatre and a $12 cab fare to downtown. The hotel staff were very good and accomodating, the hotel itself is good. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the bathrooms very nice (love the shower!). We had wished the room had a fridge that could be used rather than one stocked with liquor. Do people actually still use those liquor fridges?... The rooms are quite small, which was a little tight with two kids and my wife and me. The temperature control ( an old round dial type of thermostat) didnt work so we couldnt adjust the temperature, other then by opening a window. The hotel was reasonable value, and in a great location. We had breakfast each morning at Granville Island which is always pleasant (earlier in the day the better when its not busy.) All in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Homey and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: wkabean
Reviews.Content: Staying on Granville Island at this hotel feels like a getaway from Vancouver and the traffic, it is it's own little oasis. The staff are helpful and friendly, the room was well appointed, very clean and comfortable with a very good bed. I was taking a 4 day class at Maiwa so parked my car, shopped in the market for fresh fruit, seafood and vegetables and enjoyed my room at the end of each day. It is a gem of a hotel and I am sure my husband will enjoy it when we next visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A serene getaway”
Reviews.Author: V K
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and I stay at far to many hotels, making us a little fussy. The Granville is just wonderful. Excellent staff, perfectly new, great beds, and great breakfast overlooking the marina. We have stayed at 5 star places that were not as nice as this hotel. On top of this, we thought it was great value. V& L Saskatchewan

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Oneortwoweeks
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed here and once again it has impressed. What I like is how close it is to downtown but with the relaxing Granville feel. Walk to the market for snacks and coffee then ferry across false creek to cruise downtown. Rooms are very comfortable and bathroom is above average. Really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grey Cup Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mary-Lou G
Reviews.Content: We were appointed room a corner suite on the top floor, nicest view of the harbour ...and had a great stay! Excellent resturaunt as well. Dining room staff were very friendly as was the front desk folks and the outside "greeter". We flew in from Regina as CFL's best supporters of football(Roughrider Fans!) and enjoyed our visit. Granville Island Hotel was a very convenient property to navigate our weekend around. Also the fact they didn't raise their room rates as most hotels did for Grey Cup, we really appreciated that. In itself - reason to definently go back!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in an outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: bruce111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of Vancouver's best. It's location, 20 minutes to airport and 15 minutes downtown is ideal. You're surrounded by water and a beautiful view of the city on charming Granville Island. It's an oasis in the heart of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel w/water views surrounded by arts & artists”
Reviews.Author: seattlelive
Reviews.Content: My time here was magical! Great room w/views of the active water ferry system. The service was excellent & my greeting at the front desk warm &informative. I will return & tell others of this magical time

Reviews.Title: “A surprising experience!”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a business seminar that was being held nearby. I couldn't stay at the seminar site as the hotel was booked solid from ongoing renovations. I couldn't have been happier with my "misfortune". The hotel was a short ride from the airport and the staff were very pleasant upon check-in and check-out. The in room breakfast was exceptional and reasonably priced as were the items in the mini-bar. Free wi-fi was accessed with ease and the bed was lavish. My one suggestion would be to get some in-room movies but I would definietly stay at GIH again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: Jen00teng
Reviews.Content: The staff was all very helpful and kind. I had a problem with my credit card, and the front desk was very quick to help with alternative options. The view from the room was also very stunning. The perfect morning!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.. friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DaveCalgary
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Granville Island this hotel for business. Place was clean.. staff were helpfull and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dal123_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all, in our opinion - wonderful service, smiling faces, comfortable rooms, good food, reasonable rates, and it's located at the quiet end of Granville Island. We recently returned from a four-nght stay, and have also stayed here on previous trips. Each and every time we have been impressed with the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “November 2011 stay”
Reviews.Author: chatchBc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in Nov 2011. The hotel and service was excellent. Amazing view down False Creek. Great area being on Granville Island.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: wander1
Reviews.Content: There were a few hiccups but overall we'll stay there again. The rooms are nice (we chose one with a view of False Creek). The staff was generally good and the price was very good for Vancouver. We needed a very early cab to catch a train (5AM) and were told by the front desk that there are always cabs waiting but the following morning there were none. The morning desk staff told us they were never around that time of day. Fortunately we were able to call one in plenty of time. It seems to me it would been much easier to tell us to allow a few minutes (we did anyway) so one could be called that early in the morning. The only other note is that the bar closes at 11PM (at least on Saturday night). There's not a lot available on Granville Island so that seemed a bit odd. The hotel is very close to the wonderful Granville Island Market is close to Vancouver's very good bus system. Like I said, the hiccups were small and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy W
Reviews.Content: I was down on a business trip and met up with an old friend from school. We had the most wonderful dinner in the restarant. The service and food was top notch. The room was very clean and the beds are very comfortable. The registration personel were extremely friendly and made sure our room had a view. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes a true vancouver experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location-great time!”
Reviews.Author: kiwiheartz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended a wedding at the hotel and stayed the night- helpful, friendly staff & great food! It was fantastic beginning to end... We will come and stay again 100%

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Granville Island Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneCb
Reviews.Content: Charming and elegant boutique hotel located right on the water on Vancouver's vibrant Granville Island. Cozy and doesn't feel too hotel-y, but even standard rooms are quite upscale and newly renovated. The restaurant is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and staff, very clean”
Reviews.Author: TerryWY
Reviews.Content: We booked several rooms at the Hotel for a family event. We had relatives and friends staying at the Hotel from out of Province and Canada. Great service and staff. However, service in the Restarant attached to the Hotwl was slow (not a Hotel problem).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: Megan W
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this location. I come to this hotel enough that it feels like home. I have a lovely view of the Vancouver city skyline, False Creek, including all of the boat traffic, and the Burrard St. Bridge leading to the Dt core from Kitsilano. If you are traveling to Vancouver, this is a perfect location for you, and the Hotel is definitely upscale. Granville Island is central to the Beaches, local shops & restaurants, the Seawall etc. The restaurant attached to the Hotel is called The Dockside, and has THE BEST outdoor eating area, right on the water. I love sitting out there on a couch and sipping a cappuccino or a beer from their own micro-brewery. The restaurant staff are personable and attentive. I strongly recommend staying here, and asking for a waterfront view. The executive rooms are spacious and full of amenities that one might need, such as 2 tv's, a living area with floor to ceiling windows, a fridge, microwave, king sized bed, to name a few. The staff are helpful and kind. Thanks again G.I.H. Megan Wingham

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, with a few small quibbles”
Reviews.Author: SophiagoestoItaly
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a quick, one-night visit to Vancouver, and stayed at the Granville Island Hotel. To get there, we took the quick little ferry from downtown, and walked with our rolling suitcases to the hotel, conveniently located and yet away from any traffic. It's a calm, well-designed "boutique" hotel tucked just past the end of the road on Granville Island. Check-in was friendly and efficient, and our room, although small, was fine. Even though we had requested the basic "non-view" category, our little balcony had a view of the water across to downtown, and a bonus was the fireworks over Science World (after all, it was Halloween). My only quibbles are small. The public spaces are nicely decorated, but our room had a couple of sad "department store" prints on the walls - and considering Granville Island is a hub of artistic activity, I would have loved to see better art (why not link with the Emily Carr school of art across the street, and promote local artists?). A tiny problem, but big when you are in a hurry: offer better hair dryers than the low-powered one provided. And the most annoying: the room lighting is poor, in particular the reading light. There actually isn't any; the bedside lamp is too dim to read by. My husband tried removing the shade from the lamp, which only helped a tiny bit. On November mornings, it's great to get the newspaper delivered to the door, but until the sun came up we had trouble reading it. Those small issues aside, this is a lovely hotel in a great area, close to the attractions of Vancouver yet far enough away to provide solace. We hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: gene775
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days at an educational "intensive". Granville Island itself is very interesting, although I didn't have enough time to really explore. Great public market, lots of artistic activity. We needed to be able to provide some of our own food, so asked to have the mini bar emptied so we could use the fridge, and for a microwave, although it wasn't a regular part of the room. Staff was very obliging and cheerfully looked after our needs. My rating would have been 5 stars, except the room was quite small for two people 5 days, and the only view was over a roof and hvac unit. The restaurant was a little bit pricey for our budget.

Reviews.Title: “great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: ajs4travel
Reviews.Content: I'd have given it 5 stars if only the desk chair hadn't had arms and been a royal pain to move around. HOWEVER, everything else was lovely. I had a room with a view of False Creek, comfy beds, pleasant decor, windows that open. I didn't eat at the restaurant since I only stayed overnight & was meeting friends elsewhere, so can't comment on that. Easy walking distance to Granville Island Market, shops & theatres. An enjoyable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in interesting location”
Reviews.Author: mrtravcan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in early August this year for 3 nights. We had been on Granville Island before and wanted something close to the action there. We were very pleased with the hotel. We arrived fairly early in the day (mid-morning) and were able to check in right away. Our room was reasonably spacious, clean and well-maintained. When we had a minor problem, maintenance came immediately to look at it and fixed the issue right away. We found our room quiet and never had any noise issues. Front desk staff were very helpful in giving us hints on local activities and with check in and out, as well as bike rental. The location is close to the Granville Island market, a comedy club, theatre, the galleries and studios of the island and a small ferry ride from the recreational pathway that goes to Stanley Park and the seawall. It is located in a quiet corner of the island next to a waterside park. One night that we were there a fireworks competition was held in the English Bay area. With good directions from the front desk, we found an excellent place to watch the show for free from across the bay and were able to easily walk there and back. The hotel rents bikes (including helmets) right outside their door and by means of the small ferry (which also takes bikes) you can easily connect with your bike to the main pathways leading all the way to Stanley Park. We also made use of the bus which we caught just off the island and were able to reach the beaches area in about 20 min. There is a restaurant associated with the hotel. Our first experience at lunchtime on what was a beautiful, busy sunny holiday weekend was a bit disappointing in that the service was very slow and not super attentive. However, when we later ate breakfast there twice the waiter was exceptional - he even remembered our likes and dislikes from one day to the next. The quality of the food was good, although it was fairly expensive, as you might expect in a big city hotel restaurant. There are several other very inexpensive, informal eating choices nearby for breakfast or lunch in the Granville Is. market building. There are fewer dinner choices on island after the stores shut down, although there are some. Overall, it was a very positive experience and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “tends to get overlooked but excellent”
Reviews.Author: Pathcontrolmonk
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a quiet hotel with boutique service this is it. great restaurant downstairs with small brewpub. we had a corner suite with great views, nice bed although the room is a little crowded. great value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Option”
Reviews.Author: KenWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: Granville Island is a great location to base a trip from if you are staying in Vancouver. The Hotel was remodeled for the 2010 Olympics. The service is good. The beds and Bathrooms are both quite nice. The parking lots can be have a bit of noise but is FAR better than other hotels I've stayed in while in Vancouver. If possible try to get a room overlooking the water. The rooms on the third floor (top floor) tend to be nicer than the others. For breakfast check out the market just close to the hotel on the island. If you want to visit downtown just take the water taxi or "aqua bus" these little boats are fun, not very expensive and the quickest way to gt there. If you are a jogger simply head to the seawall and head in either direction... personally I prefer heading west towards the beach. If you want to go to Stanley Park the hotel rents bikes and pedal your way along the sea wall. Nice way to see the park and bit more of Vancouver. Being on the sea wall makes it safe and impossible to get lost. WiFi was also pretty quick

Reviews.Title: “A JEWEL WITHIN A JEWEL.....”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelSomerset
Reviews.Content: Granville Island is a very special place and all those who have visited it will know what I mean. The bewildering array of craft shops, restaurants, art and theatre activities as well as that amazing food and produce market make it an exhillarating and stimulating place to stay. Granville Island Hotel lives up to all that one would expect in such a great location and we enjoyed both our recent stays there immensely. The styly is a bit like Babington/Dean St Townhouse if you know them - stylish and modern but with high comfort levels to match. Excellent staff - superb rooms (we were lucky to be in the Penthouse on the first stay - heavenly) and a location to fie for with the all-round views across False Creek and Vancouver. If you haven't been to Granville Island and you are going to Vancouver then GO to the island - and this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth Sailing”
Reviews.Author: Lucas H
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a beautiful location. If you want to experience one of the most special parts of Vancouver, stay at the Granville Island Hotel. You are right on the water and steps away from the public market. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Setting”
Reviews.Author: MossnClover
Reviews.Content: I love the setting of this hotel. It is great to be on the "Island" and able to visit all the great shops and the Market. The two water taxis companies serving Granville Island make it very accessible to downtown as well. If you want to walk/cycle - it doesn't get better the the walking/cycling trails leading away from Granville Island. I had a room with a partial view and it was very nice. The staff were very friendly as well. I didn't have any meals at the hotel so can't comment on that. I didn't spend much time actually at the hotel so my interaction with staff was limited as well.

Reviews.Title: “jaclin”
Reviews.Author: Jack V
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very satisfactory. The hotel is well situated. The service was good. The rooms are somewhat small and quite expensive considering the size. Food services are excellent. We stay at the hotel mainly because we like to shop at Granville Island. We appreciated the favourable room rate we got because of the course at Maiwa that my wife was taking. Overall, a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Central to all of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Johncj
Reviews.Content: You might not want to leave the "island" though. But if you do the foot ferry fleet will zip you to the other side of False Creek. The only negative aspect to our room was the size, for the money charged we did expect it to be larger. Not much room to negotiate. The shower was fabulous! Overall we had a wonderful two-night stay.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATIONLOCATION”
Reviews.Author: samsara_10
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic site to walk around, have a bike ride, visit the ocean, go shopping, go on a small bot tour, its all available next to the Granville Island Hotel. I have stayed here before but my preferred room was not available. I accepted 211 but should have negotiated for a different room. It was exceptionally noisy. I rented a bike but no one offered to show me how to use the lock. After sort of figuring it out how it worked i started out for a ride to the beach. On returning i found the key went missing from the lock I had secured to the bike. Informed then at the desk on my return. Initially they were less than courteous about it but i said if there is a charge of course i would play however it might be helpful for future guests to be escorted to the bike and given a brief safety instruction prior to giving someone a key. they did agree. I stay at other expensive hotels similar to this and they do this service, they also do not charge for the bikes if you are a guest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern room. Great location”
Reviews.Author: donjoz
Reviews.Content: A very clean, modern room. Appeared to have been recently upgraded. Friendly service. Nice location on the island. It does take a bit of time and expense if you are taking taxis to the city. Went with my wife for a long weekend. Spent time at the market and nearby restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver Trip”
Reviews.Author: Victor D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close enough to downtown to walk to in 1/2 hour( using the aquabus to cross the channel) but also very close to local interesting sites on granville island and is a 15 min walk to Broadway St and 4th Ave where there are numerous placed to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Granville Island”
Reviews.Author: LaffyLaf
Reviews.Content: Ideal location on Granville Island. A great area to go for a run (around the harbour). The room was very nice and the staff most pleasant. Good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in an Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: BABURGESS
Reviews.Content: Me and my family of 3 (Myself, Wife & Son) loved staying on Granville Island. It was like a peaceful oasis in a major metropolitan area. We simply loved starting and finishing every day on Granville Island. We would eat breakfast in the Market take one of the super cute little ferries over to Vancouver, explore the city and then take a cab back for a peaceful dinner in one of the many very nice restaurants on the island. If that sounds like how you want to spend a few days in Vancouver then the Granville Island Inn is the hotel for you. For one it is the only hotel on the island and two it is a very nice hotel. The rooms are small but nice, the lobby is modern and inviting and the staff is friendly. This is not a five star hotel but you are not paying five star prices and as stated above the location is awesome. When we return to Vancouver we will be stating at the property again.

Reviews.Title: “It's our favourite place to stay in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: SusanE2011
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the ranville Island Hotel. It's close walking distance to everything we want to walk to: shops, restaurants, views and the seawall trail. We have stayed as a couple and with our children. Both experiences were excellent. Food is fab too!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place!”
Reviews.Author: 2skwanderers
Reviews.Content: What a great place! We had a superior room over looking the patio restaurant and False Creek. The room was very spacious with a lovely king size bed and nice toiletries, replenished daily. There is a little bar area with sink, microwave and mini fridge....nice touches. Couldn't have asked for a better location, and although we stayed in August, parking never seemed to be an issue except that it was $12.00 plus tax .....ouch! Overall it was an excellent stay, we will definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “This was the most comfortable bed. What a beautiful hotel. A bit pricey, but understandably.”
Reviews.Author: Rose B
Reviews.Content: We had the granola breakfast; it was a generous serving, but not enough raisins, nuts, dried fruit etc. in it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, great experience....”
Reviews.Author: Bijan504
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel. Granville Island is a charming area to say in the heart of Vancouver. The hotel is situated at the quiet end of the Island overlooking the water. The Dockside restaurant in the hotel is also outstanding in terms of location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary getaway”
Reviews.Author: ComoxTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in one of the penthouse suites facing downtown Vancouver. The room was beautiful and very spacious with amazing views of False Creek. The hotel is not far from the Aqua Bus, taxis, and the Granville Island Public Market making it easy to get around. Our room was very quiet and well appointed. The bedroom area is so sound proof that we couldn't hear each other talk in separate rooms. There are wrap-around balconies off every room with chairs and a table. We had in-room massages provided by the spa just down the road and there was plenty of space for side-by-side table setup. We ate at the restaurant for breakfast once and had room service as well. Both were good. After living in Vancouver for several years, then coming back to visit, we found this hotel gave us an entirely different perspective of the city - one that we fully appreciated! Our only slightly negative comment was that the large kitchen area had plenty of wine glasses, but nothing else - no cutlery, no plates, etc. so that when we bought food to bring back to the room, we had nothing to eat it with. However, a quick call down to the front desk had all that delivered within minutes. We mentioned this upon check-out and they seemed happy to add those items to the room in future. I would definitely come back to this hotel and bring my kids next time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, needs more updating”
Reviews.Author: sungirl18
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at the Granville Island hotel in May of this year for the second time. The location is perfect. With the convenience of the water taxis you can leave your car behind and explore the city. I love the character of Granville island. It is a wonderful eclectic community in Vancouver with great restaurants and wonderful views. The hotel is lovely, however they truly need a major room makeover. We stayed there March 2009 and it needed updating then as the furniture was pretty banged up. They made a several changes I imagine due to the Olympics last year but from what I could tell from the room we were in this time they only got part way through the redecorating. The bathroom was remodeled and very modern - they did a great job there. The furniture in the room though was a comical combination of modern minimalism (design of lamps and headboard) with the older traditional style cherry wood dresser which had seen better days. It was as if they had stopped for a lunch break halfway through decorating and forgot to start again. What made it even more challenging was that there was almost too much furniture for such a tiny room That being said ... the bed was extremely comfortable and the room was very clean. The staff were so friendly and really made our stay enjoyable. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant which was delicious. My husband is still talking about the French toast. The menu items are fabulous and wait staff were so nice. I honestly recommend this hotel as the stay is a wonderful experience !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but handicap room needed more hand bars”
Reviews.Author: Patti G
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotels, very clean large rooms. Handicap bathroom in the room needed more bars for the toilet and a shower chair would have been great. Bathroom was large enough for a wheelchair just needed more hand bars for assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Mostly Quiet”
Reviews.Author: kamloops_11
Reviews.Content: Overall a pretty nice place to stay - very clean rooms and mostly quietly - with the exception of Friday & Saturday nights. There is some entertainment venue nearby with loud music but it didn't go late - about midnight. The staff was helpful and the food in the restaurant was quite as good well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Beth A
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Granville Island Hotel. This hotel is an elegant, charming little treasure on the island. Our room was very clean and comfortable, with a cozy little balcony where we could sit and watch the water, and all the activities going on around us. We loved walking around the shops and shopping in the Public Market, and didnt have to worry about parking!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel not with kids”
Reviews.Author: Dee S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night with our 2 young children. We had a van pulling a tent trailer and they were very helpful finding us a spot to park it. The hotel was beautifully renovated and you cannot go wrong with the location right on Granville Island. It is wonderful. We found our room to be quite cramped with 2 double beds and our balcony was so full with 2 chairs and a table that you couldn't even sit there with just 2 people so we had to take the plastic table into our room while we sat out there. Other than the very small room and the cramped balcony we can't complain about anything. We would stay again but probably wouldn't bring our kids with us. Just didn't think there was much to do here with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Big Room and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: CH-Verona
Reviews.Content: We had a Wedding to attend in Vancouver and stayed a single night, if our iternary had allowed we would have stayed longer. With four adults in one room I thought it would be cramped but the room was big and the beds were big so there was plenty of space. The room and the bathroom were very clean and up to date. In addition we were on the first floor and had floor to ceiling windows that overlooked an outside dining area & the harbor which we all loved. The staff was super helpful & friendly with requests for extra towels, coffee, umbrella (when it rained), getting taxis,etc. Really it was a delightful stay and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic”
Reviews.Author: Rotkapchen
Reviews.Content: Waterfront views, great food, attentive service by all.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: AndreaK-M
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. We were greeting by an exceptionally friendly staff. Our room was beautiful and the view from it was stupendous. I highly recommend the Granville Island Hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but”
Reviews.Author: muzzmashe
Reviews.Content: Pros - Greatest location in Vancouver, dog friendly, quiet, good amenities Cons- tiny room, not very friendly staff, expensive

Reviews.Title: “For a night for two - hard to beat.”
Reviews.Author: Darryl K
Reviews.Content: Magnificent corner suite with a view of False Creek and downtown Vancouver. Impressive bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but no place to smoke and drink...”
Reviews.Author: macoracle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for some business meetings. They have a nice outdoor patio with many tables that are more than the (BC law) required 6 meters away from doors and windows, but they still don't allow you to smoke a cigar with your drinks....

Reviews.Title: “"Loved it"”
Reviews.Author: Dups72
Reviews.Content: Liked the regular housekeeping Decent sized room Excellent wash room fixtures..very contemporary Beautiful location and views of boats Good firm beds

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous weather,accommodation and food at the Dockside.”
Reviews.Author: Arthur C
Reviews.Content: Hello Christine, My wife and I were in Vancouver when Summer struck(July28-Aug.2),we were there for a family wedding which was at the Fairmount Pacific Rim,however having previously stayed on Granville Island that was and will continue to be our first choice for accommodation in Vancouver. While at the hotel we hosted a dinner for 30 people in the Dockside and everybody that I spoke with raved about the dinner,even the locals who had never been there are very keen to come back. Keep-up the good work. Arthur Colman.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased and would love to come back.”
Reviews.Author: afleice
Reviews.Content: We recently had an extremely bad stay at an American Sheraton hotel, and were a bit gunshy about staying in ANY hotel again...haha. But we were en route to Kelowna from Victoria and had some business to do in Vancouver which required a stay over. A local B&B actually recommended your hotel and we had a lovely one night stay with you. Staff were most obliging and friendly. Our evening snack on the patio was delicious, relaxing and we had a lovely server...again most helpful and obliging...and the view! Ach, beautiful!! We were initially worried as our room was adjacent to the patio and we feared lots of noise, but it was quiet after 10 pm, the beds were great and we both a great sleep, and really enjoyed visiting the market before we left for Kelowna. Now the traffic on the way to Kelowna was another thing altogether...we stayed too long and hit rush hour! But that's our fault! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: melwain
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Granville Island Hotel and it was fabulous! We had been to Vancouver Island two times in the past and have always wanted to stay at this hotel but couldn't get in. This time I planned ahead and we had an amazing time both at the hotel and enjoying all that Granville Island has to offer! We arrived early and our room wasn't quite ready but the staff immediately took our luggage to a holding room and provided us with a place to change into cooler clothes since it was a beautiful sunny day. Once our room was ready, we found our luggage already waiting for us in our room! The entire staff could not have been more pleasant and accommodating and the food, beverages and waterfront setting were wonderful as well. Thank you so much...I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The GI Hotel is right back up there: Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: wjames5
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here several times 10 and more years ago and loved it, but then noticed that the reviews became very mixed. During that interim we have stayed at other hotels downtown. Now, I'm happy to say, the Granville Island Hotel is right back near the top rank of Vancouver hotels. Its location is unsurpassed. The setting of Granville Island is an oasis in the heart of Vancouver. The island's attractions are well known and detailed elsewhere. In addition, let me say that Robson St and downtown is an easy 15-20 minute walk once you cross by Aquabus. And Broadway is just 10 minutes or so in the other direction. Parking is relatively inexpensive at $16 per day, and usually you can park almost adjacent to the entrance. If you can't find a place, the courteous valet will find one when an opening occurs and park the car for you. The convenient parking was a big plus considering all the luggage that we had to schlep inside after 5 months in Asia. Incidentally, the hotel staff were very kind in storing this luggage for us during a three-day absence from the hotel in the middle of a week-long stay. The front-desk staff were very friendly and helpful. They responded well and promptly to email requests and some changes in our reservation before arrival. We arrived at noon after an overnight flight from Japan, and a room was ready for us. Yuko, who was at the desk during much of our stay, was especially helpful and always greeted us by name. This is the way a boutique-style hotel ought to be run. The rooms are well laid out and appointed. Both of the ones we had during our stay had a partial water view, were quiet, and the layout and furnishings were of high quality. The bathroom and shower were excellent. Cleaning staff were thorough and respected "Do Not Disturb" requests as we recovered from jet lag. Despite weddings taking place during the long weekend we stayed here, they created no disruption for regular guests (except for some photo shoots in the lobby, which were more interesting than inconvenience). One problem we did experience was an obvious staff shortage in the restaurant one morning. While lined up for a table, one departing party was heard to comment: "We could wait a hundred years here and still not get served." At that point, we decided to head for the Market for our breakfast. But that for us a minor blip in an otherwise completely enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Always love to stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: polyvas
Reviews.Content: All the rooms are amazing at this Hotel. We keep coming back, because of the atmosphere, and of course the Island has so much to offer! Looking forward to our next visit there in the fall!!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: BCcherries
Reviews.Content: Any customers with wheelchairs should stay in the newer wing as the older wing has smaller door openings, especially if their wheelchair is bigger. I had to leave my chair downstairs overnight and the next day they gave us a suite on the main floor which accommodated my chair. We had a beautiful view of False Creek. The walk way is in front so you must not mind seeing people walking by or staring at you. We had Sunday Brunch which was very good and the service and the view was a bonus. We had room service twice and it was good and well presented. The closeness to the Public market and other stores was a one reason why we choose to stay there. We enjoyed our stay there and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: lookforme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Granville Island hotel for a weekend because we were getting married in their Dockside Lounge. The hotel is beautiful, and in a wonderful location. The room we had was an executive suite & it overlooked False creek. It was a treat to be able to watch the sparkling lights of downtown at night, & wake up to the outrigger paddlers and other small boat traffic in the morning. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. Our only complaint with the hotel was their room service. My bridesmaids and I ordered a pot of tea on the day of my wedding, & after an hour and half it still hadn't shown up - so we cancelled our order. I understand if room service gets busy, but it was late afternoon and it shouldn't take long to throw a tea bag on a tray with some boiled water. Other than this - we thoroughly enjoyed our stay & we will definitely be going back to celebrate our anniversaries!

Reviews.Title: “We thought this hotel was fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: SherbrookeLondon
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a fantastic location: comfortable, well equipped rooms; helpful, friendly staff; and good restaurant with dockside patio looking over to downtown. For us, much nicer than staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, as usual”
Reviews.Author: kevinklucher
Reviews.Content: We try to stay at the Granville Island Hotel whenever we travel to Vancouver. The location is the biggest draw for us, Granville Island by day is full of energy, a great place to pick up something tasty at the Public Market, find a seat, listen to the buskers and people watch. It's even better in the early morning, before all of the people arrive for the day, when you feel you have the place to yourself. Staying at the Granville Island Hotel, the only hotel on the island, lets you experience both personalities of Granville Island.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Granville Island”
Reviews.Author: Northwest_Traveler74
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about Granville Island. The location, the artistic vibe, the fantastic food (the market in our opinion is much better than Pike Place in Seattle that we visited earlier in the week) and this hotel. The hotel in a different location would have been nice, but the location really made it special for us. Within a 2 minute walk there are fantastic spots for breakfast, lunch and dinner and fun shopping and access to the sea wall. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. They have a restaurant, and while we didn't eat there, it was packed and looked really good. The restaurant deck had a great view. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Evening!!”
Reviews.Author: MeganRenay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding at Granville Island Hotel (Dockside Lounge) and we were extremely pleased with EVERYTHING. They were very helpful from the planning part leading up to the day to helping on the big day. The food was fabulous and we had A LOT of compliments from our guest about the variety and how tasty everything was. More than one person told us how they have never had such a perfectly cooked roast before. Not only was the food good on the day, the staff was super friendly, and even made my husband and I a dish of appies so we wouldn't miss out. We would highly recommend Granville Island Hotel for corporate events and weddings, you wont be disapointed! Not to mention the convenience of being able to stay in the hotel afterwards!! =) -Dan & Megan

Reviews.Title: “Great way to relax in the city!”
Reviews.Author: LadyLee1082
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a recent trip to Vancouver. Not only was it lovely and different from your standard hotel room, it was a great location. After a long day of sightseeting and driving around the city, it was so wonderful to come back to our hotel and be able to just relax on the water, or walk to get dinner and drinks. While you feel as if you're someplace entirely different, it's still convenient to the city. The only issue we had was the front desk was not entirely helpful with our questions as far as getting around the city, but they weren't unfriendly. I would definitely stay here again, and I would recommend it to anyone looking to have a more relaxing experience in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with overpriced and basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: designfanatic
Reviews.Content: I made a list while staying there Good Points * Great location and really only hotel in the kitsilano area and only one on GI * Comfortable bed * Lots of drawer space in bathroom * Good selection in mini bar ie. Chips and salsa *The restaurant deck is very nice and modern and quite a gem....too bad about the service and the food. Bad Points * half renovated the common areas are nice, the bathrooms have no bath tubs but new bathrooms. The shower fixture although very smart looking are hard to use and are very sharp due to the sharp and clean lines of design. * Small rooms * We had a small balcony but had plastic furniture and latice on the floor (not nice) * The dresser, desk and minibar are still the old furniture (too many pieces and old and ugly) It did however have a flat screen tv which should not require a piece a furniture to hold it as it should be wall mounted. As I said the rooms are too small for all that furniture. * Lamp had burnt out light bulb...not a big deal but these things should be checked upon cleaning. *The art in the rooms are old and are of Delta, why not GI? You do have a art institute across the road. *The shampoo was in a ridiculous size bottle and if anyone figures out how to get it out of the bottle I would love to know. However the soap was a good and generous size. * The doors, wallpaper and carpets need to be redone. * The restaurant has a very limited and boring menu and the service is terrible. * Way over priced and not the price I had booked online Overall this is a good choice for the location and if it is within your budget, just don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, I would return.”
Reviews.Author: KL-XVIII
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight 1 night for business travel. The place is a bit confusing to drive into at night if you're unfamiliar with the area, but my GPS showed the way. Check in was easy. The front desk clerk suggested paying $16 for parking permit "to be safe" in a 3 hour parking zone enforced between the hours of 9pm to 7am, even though I was outside those hours. I declined and had no problems. The hotel setting is very nice with water and dock views. The room was very nice, clean and new, a tad on the small side, but fine. High end bathroom fixtures, comfortable bed with premium linens, free wifi. My room was very quiet. Only room complaint was the old fashioned noisy A/C unit - noisy and musty smelling. I turned it off and opened the sliding glass door to get some cool air. Had breakfast at the restaurant. Service was fast, the food was very good and the dining room had nice water views. Overall, I really liked the place and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Granville Island Oasis: We have never slept better or been more relaxed.”
Reviews.Author: 4CNote
Reviews.Content: We were tipped off to the Property by some good friends. Last time we were in town in April it was full up. We got lucky and bought a 3 day package and stayed in one of the suites. My wife and I were sooo relaxed and slept like babies on the RestWell bed. Love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Over-Priced for Pseudo-Modern Hotel with Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: pontevecchio56
Reviews.Content: We really did not enjoy staying in this hotel. The location on Granville Island is unique, and this hotel seems to have a monopoly there, but it was not worth the outrageous prices for the room, food, and drinks. For just the room and taxes, and after the exchange rate, the tiny room costs $311 (US). I would have enjoyed a Motel 6 more. This hotel has a cold chrome, steel, and glass decor that made me feel uncomfortable. The rooms were so small that I had to step out into the hall if I wanted to change my mind. The weird mini-balcony looked out over a noisy outdoor bar scene. The shower didn't work properly, and the response of the staff at the front desk ranged somewhere between indifference and surliness. The staff must have had a bad few days before we arrived. We couldn't wait to leave this place...........and won't ever be back.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated? I Think NOT...Worst Hotel Stay in Years”
Reviews.Author: YVRme
Reviews.Content: We had a family dinner downtown and wanted to treat ourselves to a stay overnight so we could enjoy a few drinks and not worry about driving. Normally I would book the Fairmont Pacific Rim - which is glorious hotel perfection for only $60 more a night, but wanted something closer to Yaletown for brunch the next day. My BIG mistake in taking a chance on the Granville Island Hotel. This is a tired, dated hotel in a fantastic location in desperate need of either demolition or a more complete renovation. Looks like after they renovated the bathrooms (quite nicely done), they ran out of money. For $300+ a night we were transported back to 1982, complete with popcorn ceiling, mirrored walls, huge A/C units hanging crooked off the wall. Chipped and worn cherry (really...cherry??) furniture with gold hardware, old baseboards and cracked doors. Eeee gawds. The A/C by the way, sounded like a 747 engine that would suck through a seagull every 2-3 minutes - we turned it on, laughed until some tears came and turned it off. Thus we couldn't use it for sleeping and sweltered all night. I think the guests above us used theirs though, and it sounded like somebody dragging a table across the floor all night. Did not sleep - at all. Almost left at 3am. They have a brewery on site and the tanks line the 2nd floor interior space - again, something that could be really cool, but they semi-hide it behind frosted glass and it's full of cardboard boxes and junk. Nice. If you have something like that, showcase it - clear glass, keep it spotless and show off your equipment. Somebody with some vision could turn this into a world class hotel - the location on False Creek is great, but not utilized as it should be. As it stands they are just trading on the location. Sad. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kpmack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the way to our cruise boat to Alaska. We liked it so we book a room for the day we got back from Alaska also. There was a great market on the island and walking paths. The Marina was great to take a short ride around False Creek.

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT patio!”
Reviews.Author: joncgc
Reviews.Content: We had a business meeting at the Granville Island Hotel. THe room and food were great, but the part I liked most was sitting on the patio for lunch. The food, the view and ambiance were all spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Great Over The Years”
Reviews.Author: qppstudio
Reviews.Content: I have been at the Granville Island Hotel for business for 3 separate weeks, in 2007, 2008 and earlier this month. Over all these years, I have found the staff to be friendly and efficient, the restaurant and room service to be great, and the location on Granville Island ever so enjoyable (particularly if you have time to kill on a weekend). My only complaint is that this year the old TVs were replaced by nice flatscreens (good) but that in the process the pay-per-view movies disappeared, meaning that one is left with regular North American TV (ie. 8 minutes of commercials for 22 minutes of TV). Do avoid getting a room overlooking the restaurant patio as there will often be a lot of noisy diners there until very late.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel and in such a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: formsguy
Reviews.Content: Vancouver is one of the most beautiful cities in the world. The Granville Island Hotel allows you to view it from one of the best locations in Vancouver ... Granville Island. This really is a fabulous hotel. It's in a perfect location, it's been recently updated, it's very clean, it has a lovely patio to enjoy the views from, it's located on Granville Island with it's many charming spots to shop, dine and enjoy the fabulous farmers market, it really couldn't be better. My wife and i keep coming back, and every time we stay we think how lucky we are to have found this hotel. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - second time stay, will be back”
Reviews.Author: plannerpie
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, quiet, but convieninent, great views, awesome deck and outdoor restaurant. Nice clean room, comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar!!”
Reviews.Author: samsara_10
Reviews.Content: The reception staff, AWESOME. My Room, very small but it met all my needs. The linen quality was DIVINE! I had a small deck overlooking the ocean that was breathtaking. I caught the sunset and the sunrise. What more could you ask for. (Rm # 308) highly recommended, any of the rooms that face the sea would give you the same view. The restuarant was WORLD CLAss!! I have traveled the world and i can say this ranks in the top 10. I rented a bike rom the hotel and i recommend this as a route to see the island however i say go first thing in the morning as opposed to the afternoon. Much less people and you can speed around with ease. thank you for a grand stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great water views.”
Reviews.Author: cookiemonsteratl
Reviews.Content: The Granville Island Hotel was overall really nice. The room itself was clean, the bathroom was very modern, and the views of the water/harbor were very pretty. The hotel's bar and restaurant were both very nice, offered good food and beverages. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The only reason I did not give it 5 out of 5 stars is because of its location. Granville Island was a little too touristy for me. It features a children's carnival, which is great for families, but not very appealing to business travelers. There also is not a commuter train stop on Granville Island, so you have to pay for a taxi or water taxi if you don't have a rental car. All of that said, I would still stay here again, but would be prepared for needing cash for taxis.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great experience and will definitely be back for more!!!”
Reviews.Author: milo094
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful time visiting the Granville Island and staying at the Grandville Island Hotel was a primary factor. The Hotel, its location, staff and service was exceptional making our visit a memorable experience. We are planning to visit Vancouver again in late summer or early fall and will definitely stay the Granville Island Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surreal, wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: IssyCoug
Reviews.Content: You just can't beat the location in the center of Vancouver right on the shores of False Creek. I've been back many times since the first of the year. The staff are friendly, service is good. Most of the rooms have fantastic views of the harbor, boat traffic and the Vancouver skyline. The hotel should go through and upgrade all showers to the same upscale standard and some of the wall mounted air conditioneres need to replaced or updated. The food is quite good given the many high quality alternatives in Vancouver. My only suggestion is they should bag deep fried pottaoes with breakfast and go with herb roasted red potatoes - a much healthier choice.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: raegan3
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at this beautiful boutique hotel was perfect. The staff went out of their way continuously to ensure that all our needs were met. From storing our excessive baggage to supplying us with umbrellas, we were always cared for! The breakfasts were delicious and the bedding was positively heavenly. I will be returning regularly for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Our son's wedding was beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: i_rodin
Reviews.Content: We live in Langley, so didn't come far. Our son and new daughter-in-law decided on the Dockside restaurant for their reception so we thought we would also stay the night at the hotel to extend the fun and relax. It was all lovely, beautiful venue with the patio and city and water view, delicious food, all the guests and a great time! The staff was very helpful and attentive, the evening was seamless from appies to dinner to dessert....just ended too soon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: jaygordo
Reviews.Content: Not the easiest to get to, but once you arrive you are set for the rest of your visit. Easy access to downtown, Science Centre, English Bay, etc. via AquaBus, and that's only if you have time to do any of that after checking out all the great places on the Island. Also an easy walk to 4th Ave. which is great up towards Arbutus, Kits beach, and you can step right out the hotel door onto the SeaWall for a run around False Creek. That being said, my room was only okay. I think the bathroom was recently reno'd and it was great, but the rest of the room was pretty ho-hum, and even a little run-down/old looking. I expect more considering the price. The event I attended had a lunch and reception in the restaurant and the food was fantastic. I probably wouldn't eat there though if I was paying for it myself as the menu was pretty expensive and there are several great places to eat elsewhere on the Island.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned”
Reviews.Author: wbabronco
Reviews.Content: Great place if you want to explore Granville Island. A bit expensive for the standard of room but is ideally positioned to also explore downtown by water taxi. I found the staff in the bar ignorant but the Hotel staff were extremely helpful

Reviews.Title: “The Best Quiet Spot in Downtown Vancouver!!”
Reviews.Author: Surfnut007
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Granville for at least 4 to 6 weeks a year, and find it to be the best place in Vancouver to stay at, and entertain guests from. GREAT LOCATION!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: PegCO
Reviews.Content: The Granville Island hotel concierge helped us get tickets on the trolley tour, and we are very glad we did. It was a fun, informative, and flexible way to view the entire city. We also sat on the balcony of our room to watch the boats go by and enjoy the view. The rooms were well appointed. We especially loved the modern shower with rainfall, massage, and regular options. The restaurant also has a terrific view and the people were very nice. The location of the hotel also makes it easy to have a stroll around Granville Island, but you'll need a taxi to get to the clubs and shopping in the city proper. If we have to pick something we missed, and it's hard to do, we would have loved a hot tub on premises. We will definitely return to Granville Island Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Prime location for quick trip for 2”
Reviews.Author: Brigitte035
Reviews.Content: Awesome check-in service as they were able to quickly set us up for early check in and a sweet room with a view of the water. The beds were luxuriously comfortable. The shower with the rain shower head felt so good. The hot tub/sauna facilities are pretty disappointing as there are workout machines right in the same spot. We were primed for a soak after tons of walking in the rain!! The workout equipment is again lame with minimal machines and people soaking in the tub right beside you. They really need to fix that up. I purchased the Bed and Breakfast package but was disappointed that the bill for a moderate breakfast was always more than the package would cover. Not a huge deal but still a hassle. All on all I'd stay here again for a couple night get away for 2. Can't beat the location in one of my favourite spots Granville Island.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: LMP054
Reviews.Content: Great location, very quiet but interesting setting. I have stayed here many times.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: emeraldgirl55
Reviews.Content: Truly a hidden gem! The staff were friendly and courteous, and the room and bed were comfortable. Really enjoyed sitting out on the patio enjoying the sun and the view. 3 visits to the dining room left me feeling a little conflicted. The food selection and the food itself were excellent, but the service was less so. Staff seemed flustered, not organzed, particularly at the host(ess) desk.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: canuckrs4
Reviews.Content: I booked an upgraded King room with a view and ended up beside the elevator in a room that looked pretty dated and uninviting. Same quality as a Sandman hotel but paid $250 per night for the room. It was an acceptable hotel, but definitely not worth the outlandish price.

Reviews.Title: “great location, young staff the best”
Reviews.Author: lilmikeyzz
Reviews.Content: granville island is a community in itself. you could easily spend most of your time there since there are lots of restaurants and a fantastic public market featuring lots of food. you can set off on serious walks or just hang out and watch the local water scene. quiet at night without the often ugly street level scene you encounter at more glamorous high-rises (yes the high-rises can give you great views but coming out at street level you feel like you've walked into a seedy bus station environment). A design school campus brings a funky element to the scene as well as individual artist studios. Overall seems to be a part of life for Vancouver residents so you're not stuck looking at crowds of unattractive tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really lovely!”
Reviews.Author: mairc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the simple reason of location. And Man! Was that a great reason to stay here. The hotel itself was average plus, but as I mentioned the location nails it. Seems the rooms were a bit limited when we stayed so the room wasn't as much as I had hoped. There was a large function going on when we got in 11:00 ish on a Sunday night. Really rocking and that's not a bad thing eh :) But chasing down something to eat this late on the island was hopeless. Understandable for the hour and it being a Sunday. Did check out the restaurant during regular business hours several times and the food, service and beer brewed on premisise was an all around thumbs up! The market is a must go too. I don't care where you've been in your travels. It's a really cool market. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Escape”
Reviews.Author: Victoria19
Reviews.Content: Water view, executive suite. Very comfortable and fantastic views of False Creek and Yale Town. King size bed with quality linens. Granville Island market, shops and galleries great places to visit. Harbour Ferries make it easy to go just about anywhere or just take a lovely tour of False Creek. Everything at your fingertips. Great hotel staff. Fine dining in diningroom, lounge, or outside during fine weather. Snacks and meals available everywhere on Granville Island.

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect spot to enjoy Granville Island and its surroundings.”
Reviews.Author: Danusia7
Reviews.Content: We really liked the hotel and our room - it was our first time there since it was renovated - we were impressed with the renovation. The staff were very friendly and we got very good service. Loved the shower and the bedding. I have only one suggestion to make it a perfect stay: I'm a 55 yr. old woman and as we get older, we need better light & magnification to put on make-up. You should add magnified make-up mirrors (attached to the wall on a swing-out arm). The only place that I've ever seen this is at the Waterfront Suites in Sydney, B.C. (it's one of our favorite places to stay) - there must have been a woman involved in their en suite designs. In your room, I had to sit at the window and prop up my tiny magnified mirror on our suitcases. Unfortunately, no one puts adequate lighting in bathrooms and the only way to get close enough to the mirror to apply make-up is to lean over the counter which is very uncomfortable. Of course, that's just MY opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Classic comfort!”
Reviews.Author: Lou499153
