Reviews.Content: My favorite place to stay in Vancouver, excellent location, comfy beds, helpful staff, soothing ambience, convenient parking. Quiet!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: NOLAfans
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Granville Island Hotel a few times for business. It is an excellent location and the staff are very friendly and helpful. It is quite a small hotel, rooms are very nice, restaurant food is good. Excellent support for organizing meetings. My only complaint is that the business centre has older computers and I had troubles getting them to recognize my memory stick.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Jeffers0n12
Reviews.Content: We live on the North Shore and decided to have a down town holiday. Granville Island Hotel was brilliantly located in the middle of False Creek activity. Hotel was friendly, staff helpful, room lovely, bathroom really lovely, restaurant and bar great food and drink and service. Took the little aquabus across to Yaletown and rode bikes along sea wall. Took Aquabus back via Science World, live theatre on Granville island, great exploring all over the island - shops, food market, craftspeople and artists. Great fun for us and would be good for a family. And they takes dogs. Simply a lovely time for us and the sun shone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly staff- it is the only hotel on Granville Island”
Reviews.Author: KrisYoungOne
Reviews.Content: It is the only hotel on the island however it is so convenient as a base to tour the island, eat & play! Beautiful views from every room, friendly staff and nice restaurant. I felt the room quality of furnishings could be updated and sized more appropriately for the room size. The beds were extremely comfortable and plush! I loved the bath products given for our use/convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: mcbainjoe
Reviews.Content: If you've never been to Granville Island in Vancouver, you should definitely stay at the Granville Island Hotel. Normally, you can only park for 3 hours on the island, which isn't nearly enough time to wander around and see everything, but the hotel offers free parking. The Hotel is easy to get to from the Airport, Check-in was smooth, and the staff was very helpful. Every day we would get up and walk the short walk to the "Public Market" and have our breakfast or lunch. It was delightful! The Dockside restaurant is also lovely. We ate there the night before the wedding, and were not disappointed. Great food and great service. My only complaint is that our small room was over top of where shipments came in, and so it was often loud with trucks backing up, and people making noise. Also, in this room there was no view, which for a prairie girl was a bit disappointing. All in all, though, a very lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Hotel and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: dhipp
Reviews.Content: A very memorable stay at a hidden gem on Granville Island

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver central yet peaceful”
Reviews.Author: atlinites
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on many occasions and always want to come back. Because of airline schedules we always arrive at YVR about 10am. If booked room is not yet ready on arrival friendly staff arranges for replacement. We happen to stay in the same room several times. Last time (this april) bathroom was completely renovated with nice shower stall (our preference) in stead of tub. Globe and Mail in front of your door in the morning. Great locations: take cab from YVR and rest (Grandville, downtown, Broadway) is walkable: good for us and good for the environment! (We are 65+). No sirens in the middle of the night!! Nice bright breakfast facilities. Not much to not like.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: c2gether
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Granville Island Hotel for a couple of nights. Pros... Location, location, location Clean rooms New updated bathrooms Free WIFI in rooms Good front desk staff Cons... Overpriced breakfast - didn't eat other meals here so couldn't comment Quirky lounge that has no real character Rooms are small When on Granville Island check out the Sandbar Restaurant. The upper level overlooks the water and is literally underneath Granville Street Bridge - really cool!!! If you're a runner take the seawall route toward Kits Beach - great trail for running!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best people work here, our room view was spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Terracetrader
Reviews.Content: What a spot ! Needed to stay in Vancouver for 3 nights for a health review at UBC. The people that work at the front desk are charming, very polite & helpful. The restaurant food was excellent. What better place to be than Granville Island. The only hotel there, so book early.

Reviews.Title: “We love the location of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AnkecaOrganics
Reviews.Content: This is our favourite hotel in Vancouver and we come back every year. We love the friendly staff, the awesome location, very comfortable rooms and good food in both restaurant and pub. We like to walk to the market or to one of the many great restaurants Granville Island has to offer. New is the complimentary wireless highspeed internet connection, very convenient! The only downside of this hotel is that there is a brewery right among the hotel. This causes some noise and smells in one wing of the hotel. We always ask for a room in the wing away from the brewery, which also has bigger rooms. If you come in a car, Parking is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in a great location. Service could be better”
Reviews.Author: mebcSunPeaks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Granville Island Hotel for three nights with my nine year old daughter (business and pleasure). Loved that it was quiet and we could sleep through the night. Can't say the front desk staff are the friendliest - not one hello when I walked by the front desk at any time. No "how was your stay with us" when I checked out. Didn't really feel like the staff cared that much, but the restaurant staff were great - enjoyed the views, the meals. Even though it certainly wasn't the friendliest hotel I've stayed at in Vancouver, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: SteveMcC_1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on the way to whistler and the whole was great. Chic decor, friendly staff and lovely room. Breakfast in the Dockside was very good and lovely view over false creek. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: robnleigh
Reviews.Content: We will definately stay here again. The hotel was cute, trendy and in an amazing location. Granville Island is so fun and there is so much to walk to and check out. The hotel staff was lovely, our room was trendy and very comfortable. We had a balcony with chairs to sit outside in the sun and watch the city. The bathroom was very nice. No refrigerator but there was a minibar if you had to put something in it! There is a nice hottub to enjoy as well. Great Place.

Reviews.Title: “A unique and charming oasis in a busy metropolis!”
Reviews.Author: Pepasita
Reviews.Content: A charming place to stay in a great area away from the usual city noise . Parking with the taxes adds up. The waterfront suites are like no other! One of our favourite places to stay when in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 'unwind package' was exactly what we needed and in an a Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Allicat8321
Reviews.Content: We arrived and right away the staff were helpful. The one woman at the desk was dealing with an elderly WomAn that was taking a very long time talking. The woman at the desk saw I was waiting and made sure she got another person to come out and help me. I requested a room with a view and a rain shower and a king bed and I recieved all my requests, I was very pleased. The room was beautiful, the staff were very pleasant and the food from the restiarant Downstairs was delicious. They had very fast room service as well. Highly enjoyed our stay and the next time we have the money to go out for a nice weekend again, we will definitely be going back here :)

Reviews.Title: “The "sweet spot" of Vancouver hotels.”
Reviews.Author: CCRNseattle
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here after reading reviews from this site. First time in February with my wife, second time with my nephew, both for Vancouver Canucks hockey games (best record in NHL, but lost both times, go figure!). The hospitality is first rate, the Dockside Restaurant (their partnering on-site eatery) is also up to the task to provide first rate cuisine. Call for one of their packages, and you will get free parking on Granville Island (which is impossible to find). Granville Market is the best place to load up on unique items not found in Seattle. Bring a cooler for the drive back. As a matter of fact, the U.S. border agent will ask what you have bought from Granville Market. Watch out as they might try to take your Naimamo bars. you bought away. Only negative is that our U.S. Dollar's value is in danger for the first time in my life of not being accepted on "par." That's another issue which is not fair to ding this hotel. Great place, great stay, will come back again for the unique Penthouse room!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great service! And great location! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: duffybouy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and thoroughly enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location & Very Comfortable Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: JKNonthego
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay in Vancouver to attend a family event. Located in a wonderful location for walking and sightseeing, we loved being close to the Granville Island market, and enjoying the stunning maritime scenery of Vancouver. Our room with king bed was incredibly comfortable, easy to temperature control, well-lit and well-equipped. All staff we dealt with - front desk, housekeeping, dining room - were very accommodating and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “You won't go wrong staying at this fine hotel.”
Reviews.Author: happygirl064
Reviews.Content: Very well run, so clean, staff happy and courteous. The new bathrooms are fabulous, and the sheets were egyptian cotton. Quiet at night. Beautiful view. Great walkways surrounding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful weekend at the Granville Island Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LoisLane1949
Reviews.Content: On several occasions we have visited Granville Island, and on at least one occasion have eaten at the Granville Island Hotel. We had however never stayed at this hotel until this weekend. I bought my husband a "weekend getaway/theatre package" for Christmas, which included an executive suite at the Granville Island Hotel, dinner at the hotel, and tickets to a theatre production. We could not believe the view when we walked into our room. It was outstanding. We didn't even turn on either of the two TV's while there - we just sat and looked out the window at the ever changing scenery. It was very hard to leave. Most everything else about the hotel was great as well - the size of our room, the friendly staff, a great dinner and breakfast, again with outstanding views from the dining room. We only have two comments - we were planning on a "nightcap" when we got back from the theatre on a Saturday night at 10:30 - only to discover that both the dining room and the lounge were closed at this early hour. Not what we expected to find in Vancouver. Luckily we had our own wine, and raided the mini bar for some munchies. The only other comment is about the huge trees that are planted directly in front of the million dollar view. Fortunately the trees were not yet in bloom so we still had a great view, but that will be more limited in few weeks. While we love trees, it always amazing to us why they are not more strategically placed! Overall a great weekend experience, and we will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: angeanz
Reviews.Content: Our family travelled to Vancouver to attend a wedding. We had a wonderful time and we can easily recomment the Granville Hotel. The rooms are small, due to it being an older building, but have been kept updated beautifully. The beds were very comfortable, with a large screen tv in the room too. The bathroom was great, we all loved the rain shower!! On the wedding day we had an afternoon stretch of time between events, so had a few family members come to our room for champagne and cheese etc. The concierge kindly supplied us with enough champagne glasses for us all. Security in the building was excellent as well. There were so many great restaurants and pubs etc to choose from within easy walking distance. Sunday brunch was delicious, and reasonably priced, in the restautant downstairs. The views of the marina and park were lovely, and we were able to enjoy the Granville Island market too. The Market offers almost any ethnic food type you could desire, and fresh breads, pastries, coffee, and fresh fruits and veggies. Local artists offer goods of every kind, and price range too. There is even a Granville Island brewery! All in all, a very great place to visit and stay.

Reviews.Title: “The favorite Vancouver hotel”
Reviews.Author: 27TVT
Reviews.Content: Great location on the water, close to everything but not in the noisy business centre to which charming Aquabus ferries take you in a few minutes' ride over false creek. Modern rooms, well equipped with excellent beds, internet access, flat screen TV and bathrooms with showers that deserve their name. Friendly and professional staff at the reception and in the restaurant make up for my only point of criticism, the open kitchen in the restaurant area that many people might like but I don't favor. All in all great value for money and my favorite Vancouver hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best places we have ever stayed!!”
Reviews.Author: imahouse2
Reviews.Content: We LOVE the Granville Island Hotel-------------------stayed there a lot last year while purchasing the Rainbow Hunter, and were so excited to be back last weekend!! We brought friends who had never been to your hotel, and they raved about it too. Thanks for the comfortable and friendly stay-------------------we'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Very reliable for cost, quality and service! Never a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: bizzybizzy
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and I always look forward to staying at the Granville because I always get what I expect which is good value for the money and a very nice stay. The service from employees is always professional and courteous, the room is extremely clean, the restaurant food is good and the view is impeccable. The location of this hotel is second to none! Will keep coming back without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “This property always makes my Stay in Vancouver wonderful"”
Reviews.Author: Tonyn7
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Grandville Island hotel always makes my stay in Vancouver a special experience. I have stayed here on business, with Family and with friends and no one has ever been anything but totally impressed. The staff, rooms and food are outstanding and the there's the location. This location is amazing- I mean you don't have to drive anywhere to get food, drink, entertainment and culture. Water Taxi's and walking paths are right there if you want to head out to English Bay or Yaletown. I love this property.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JohnSTraveller
Reviews.Content: I'm almost reluctant to write this review, because I don't want prices at this great little hotel to go up. Granville Island Hotel is located in one of the best spots in an increasingly bustling city of Vancouver. Its out of the way, but in the middle of everything. Close to the market, the Arts Club Theatre, funky shops and downtown. My 11 year old daughter marvelled at the Toy Store, loved the food fudge vendors and even the buskers tunes. The standard room was a good size, clean and attractive. We opened our window to a view of the creek. Parking was an extra charge, but cheaper than downtown, and unless you're staying in the burbs, parking is going to cost you. I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A short but sweet stay!”
Reviews.Author: AfricaCarol
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Granville Island Hotel for one night this week. I gave a presentation in one of their meeting rooms which was expertly set up and monitored by the staff. My guests were greeted and welcomed as they came in and then shown to the meeting room - they were impressed with the helpfulness of the staff. I traveled with my Boston Terrier, Sophie, who was treated like the queen of Granville Island for the night and we went for some lovely walks in the area - very peaceful! Room service was excellent and again -the staff very helpful. All in all, was an excellent experience right from booking to checking out.... and I travel a LOT! I recommend this hotel for it's location and charm - anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and people!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaClan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times for business and with my family. It is the perfect location near the water, all the museums, the water taxis and the great Market. The people working at the Hotel are so friendly and helpful, I will certainly return. The restaurant has very good food and looks out on the water too. We have a dog so like that it's pet friendly and they have a pet daycare that can pick up at the Hotel too. You can also rent bikes nearby for touring.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Awesome Location and Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: TheGGoose
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to Granville Island Hotel in eight years and both times have been exceptional; last time I didn’t know about tripadvisor though! I’ve been here for nine days and I couldn’t be happier. I looked at a few different rooms and they vary in size and view. They’re currently renovating all the bathrooms and the new look is beautiful; even nicer than the Hyatt Regency where I stayed a few days prior to this hotel. All the rooms have been remodeled with nice big screen TVs, very comfortable beds and nice décor. Even the bathrooms in the rooms where the bathrooms have not yet been remodeled are still very nice. I recommend room 326… vaulted ceiling with cedar beams, king bed, wet bar and a fantastic water view… at a standard room price. The service is fantastic… in nine days I’ve only encountered nice, friendly, helpful, courteous, attentive and caring employees. A special shout-out to Christine, AJ, Oleg Adam and Kim for their help. They go above and beyond and seem to really enjoy making sure the guests are happy. The housekeeping service is excellent; the room was spotless every day. At the hotel’s restaurant where I ate often, the service was attentive and friendly; they even went out of their way tonight to make a strawberry compote for the cheesecake because I didn’t want the cherry compote! They asked me if I wouldn’t mind waiting as they offered to make it from scratch… highly worth the wait. I also recommend the huevos rancheros for breakfast. The food is excellent and the view is amazing. Granville Island is an oasis inside a city. If you’re looking for an active nightlife then this isn’t the right fit. If you’re looking for a walk-able and relaxing spot then this couldn’t be better! I travel often, I stay in many nice hotels and I really can’t find any suggestions for improvement here. In Vancouver, I’ll only stay here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Luxury”
Reviews.Author: GGSTU
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Granville Island Hotel for a conference meeting. It is located ~30mins cab ride from Vancouver airport on Granville Island. The location is amazing, Granville Island is a tourist hotspot, filled with art galleries and a indoors farmers market which is a must see and great place for lunch. The hotel is located right on the water. Very helpful and polite staff, they will go the extra mile for you. The hotel is very modern, with the feel of a boutique 5 star hotel. Restaurant in the hotel, plus many on Granville Island to choose from. Hotel also has a sauna and hot tub for use. The rooms are very clean, equipped with large flat screen TV and complimentary internet. A good launching pad if you are staying in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed...”
Reviews.Author: CaniwiChick
Reviews.Content: Great service (especially at the front desk and in the restaurant). Great food. Great views. Superb location. What more could a traveller ask for--except for maybe free parking. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: oliviersavard
Reviews.Content: I lived in Vancouver, and when I go back, this is for sure the first hotel I am looking for. The hotel is nice, the restaurant is great, and it is really central. The best of all is that it is located on Granville Island. There is great restaurants close by, downtown is easily accessible, you have an amazing view of the city and the mountains, and you can have a quite night of sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous location and great food”
Reviews.Author: sunshower82
Reviews.Content: The Dockside restaurant has beautiful views and fantastic food, especially their eggs benedict for breakfast and the watermelon feta salad for dinner! My huband and I tried all the types of beers in a little flight from the micro-brewery onsite. It was perfect. I have stayed here twice and would stay again. The first time I stayed was in the summer and I borrowed a bicycle from the front desk and biked around the seawall, what a great experience. The galleries on Granville and market are fun to see as well.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: talktomona
Reviews.Content: Checked into the hotel on Granville Island for a 3 night stay and our first reaction was WOW! A beautiful large modern style room with lots of windows. Great kind bed with very nice soft linens and fluffy towels. Best shower ...the bathroom was huge with an amazing huge ceiling shower head. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. The restaurant too was really great and prices were in line with good restaurants in Vancouver. Although the hotel has parking for a daily fee, it is best not to bring your car as the island is definitely best seen on foot and driving on the island is difficult as pedestrians are everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “great spot, love granville island”
Reviews.Author: tcoopr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you want to explore granville island. Our room was clean and large. The hotel restaraunt was ok, not outstanding but pretty good. The bar was really nice and I spent a nice couple hours there on a sunny afternoon enjoying a slow pint. You can walk to everything on granville island and there is a lot to see and do there. We had been to granville before but this was the first time we stayed at the hotel. Its a much better way to see the island. No fuss about parking. walk everywhere and return to your room for a drink and a hot tub when you are done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TimF_10
Reviews.Content: Have attended several meetings at Hotel, rooms are large and comfortable, staff always helpful. I have had a couple of great meals at the restaurant. I can not think of a better place to be on a sunny day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Staffing PR Issues”
Reviews.Author: BCHeart3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Granville Island Hotel the weekend of September 30 through to October 3, 2010. 'We' includes my mother, now 89, and my two other sisters. Although we do not live in BC now, we were born there and try to get back as often as we can. We love it and it's very hard to upset us when we go back for our visits. Usually, B.C. can do no wrong!! The location of the hotel is great. The front desk staff were wonderful Unfortunately, our room was extremely cramped. The bathrooms are poorly designed. Especially in B.C., with their environmental initiatives, we were surprised that they didn't have towel racks to hang your used towels to dry and the hotel only offered two 'hook's to dry towels. There were two queen beds in the room and it was cramped having two people stay in the room. I couldn't imagine having more than two in the room. We had a wonderful dinner Friday night, celebrating our reunion with our cousin who we hadn't seen in a long time. Jeremy, our waiter, couldn't have been better. He was absolutely wonderful and helped us create a dinner we will never forget. Thank you, Jeremy! You were the best! I wish the same could be said for our breakfasts which were poor. Don't order the shrimp-lemongrass omelette. Instead of using the lemongrass for flavouring, they grind the lemongrass into the omelette and the result is sharp sticks in your mouth and you can't taste the shrimp. Combine that with a waiter who pours coffee across your cup, saucer and table, doesn't come back to ask you how your meal tastes, and you wonder where he was trained. The next day there was a wedding, so we were seated in the lounge for breakfast. There was one waiter working really hard, while ours kept disappearing to use his cell phone. In fact, he didn't even try to hide. We felt sorry for the one waiter still trying to work hard. He was much shorter than our tall waiter, and that's the only way I can describe them. If you want a hotel because your events centre around the island, then I would recommend this hotel so long as you're not expecting much room in a standard room. I would avoid the dining room completely for breakfast, unless you are only there for the view, which is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: marsharrier
Reviews.Content: This superb hotel on Granville Island is hard to beat. In a beautiful, quiet location, it has so much to offer. Overlooking a marina and with fine views over Vancouver it really is ideally situated. So apart from location, what else commended it to me? First, wonderful staff who were so attentive to my needs, treating and speaking with me with respect that is often hard to find in modern hotels. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Secondly, the room was well equipped, the decor tasteful and the bed was extremely comfortable. Thirdly, the restaurant was excellent. The staff were simply delightful and the food is hard to beat ..... anywhere! Being a only a few minutes walk to Granville Island Market and a variety of nice, small shops was a bonus. A short, inexpensive ferry ride to Downtown Vancouver makes it an ideal place to stay if you want to explore the main shops or get to some of the other major attractions. Buses also run from the entrance of Granville Island to Downtown. At the end of a tiring day, the hotel hot tub is the ideal place to unwind and ease those aching limbs. I didn't try the gym equipment. Staying at the Granville Island Hotel was a real highlight of my Canadian tour, and I was very sad to be leaving. I thoroughly recommend it on all fronts. Thank you for a wonderful, relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...good location, not great service”
Reviews.Author: DDraper
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a wedding last weekend and the location was handy. Unfortunately they just don't have the level of service that would make them a great hotel. The staff just seemed disinterested, especially at the bar and the front desk. And what kind of hotel charges for local calls?! Oh, and the sauna was broken.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience in a great place!”
Reviews.Author: thunderbird_10
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel experience on Granville Island. The hotel is clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Being on Granville Island is about the best experience you can have on a vacation. Just a great hotel and a great place to be!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect venue for our meetings with responsive staff, great food and an inspiring atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Darpie
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to work with the team at the Granville Island Hotel to set up 2 days of catered meetings. From reviewing the meeting room options to choosing menus and getting setup, the process was fast and smooth. The staff were responsive to requests for supplies and adjustments for our meetings. Feedback on the guest rooms from our out of town attendees was excellent. Pricing/value was impressive compared to other venues I looked at for these meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: RoverAlberta
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here September 6th and 7th. We were promptly greeted for check in by very polite staff. I had requested a view of the water and the room was lovely. The bed and bedding was amazingly comfortable and appeared to be very high quality. The front desk supervisor greeted us by name as we came and went during the two days which I was quite impressed by. The restaurant has a fabulous view of the harbour which we enjoyed both mornings for breakfast. The service in the restaurant was a bit snobbish and I didn't get the condiments I requested the second morning, however this is minor in my opinion. If we return to the area I would definitely stay here again. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel if you wish to be in the Granville Island area. Cab to the city centre was $13-14 dollars. Cabs are readily available streetside.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Location for a Wedding”
Reviews.Author: afuzzie
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding reception at GI Hotel last week and couldn't have been more thrilled with the location, venue, food and overall service excellence that we received. From the initial planning to the evening event, the staff went our of their way to make us feel special, and paid attention to every detail of our requests. We stayed overnight in one of the rooms which was on the small side, but beautiful views and excellent room service for breakfast the following morning. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, Alexandra MceKenzie, Sales & Catering Coordinator and all the staff to anyone looking to plan a magical event in a most beautiful setting.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Nice hotel. Clean”
Reviews.Author: deltic
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for two nights prior to taking off on a motorcylce tour of BC and Alberta. I'd stayed in Vancouver before and visited Granville Island so thought this would make an ideal place for our first couple of nights in order for my son to see a bit of Vancouver on his first visit to the city. There's always lots to see and do on Granville, even if most places do close early in the evening. The Aqua Bus terminal is a short walk from the hotel and this will whisk you across False Creek into the main part of town in no time. The Hotel was recommended by a friend who stayed there in 2008, prices have risen sharply since then but I decided to go ahead and book it up anyway. Check-in was hassle free and within 10 mins of arriving at the reception we were on our way to our room. The room was nothing special but it was clean and comfortable with a nice bathroom / shower. Reception staff were very helpful and personable - given that we'd just flown into Vancouver and had needed to wear most of our motorcycle gear to travel in from the UK as it was too bulky to pack. We must have looked a fright but they never turned a hair Breakfast wasn't included in the room cost but we ate at the hotel anyway as there's not a lot of choice on Granville for breakfast other than the hotel, the other eating places there don't open up 'til around lunch time. The breakfast served up by the hotel however, was pretty good and there was certainly plenty of it, the waitresses were very helpful and pleasant The only real downside to this hotel is that it isn't cheap, in fact I would say it was quite overpriced for what it offers. Take it away from this location and you have what is quite an ordinary hotel. In fact our room wasn't overlooking the waterfront, so being in there we could have been in any run of the mill corporate hotel in the world. Budget in the pricey breakfast and the cost goes up even more per night. What I did like about the Granville though is that their prices are fully inclusive of taxes so there are no nasty surprises when you come to check out, unlike certain other hotels in Vancouver. This is a hotel I would stay at again, but before booking I would try to negotiate a better deal to get the price down a bit. There are lots of hotels in Vancouver so there's plenty of choice to use as a bargaining tool.

Reviews.Title: “Location = Dollars”
Reviews.Author: 2FromTrona
Reviews.Content: If this hotel were in any other location it would be quite average. Rooms are on the small side, comfortable enough but a little dated looking. The big selling feature is obviously the location and that's what you pay for. We were there 2 nights for a wedding and it was perfect for that and as a base to see Granville Island (before the tourist hordes arrive and the place becomes gridlocked). Service was good in the hotel. Sat outside for a drink one night, good snack food but dreadful coffee and not very good service from the waiter. Would recommend with some cautions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, small room”
Reviews.Author: portlandmom12
Reviews.Content: On vacation with my husband and 2 year old. Great location with great access to ferries, parks, kids market. Loved the public market. Our room was small but very comfortable. Snacks at the restaurant overlooking the water was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay .. Great Location... Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Duffinator
Reviews.Content: My girl friend and I stayed at the Granville Island Hotel last week and were really impressed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Not only did the staff recommend the touristy parts of Vancouver but they also shared their own favorite parts of Vancouver that made our trip feel special! The rooms were smaller but well laid out. The beds... oh the beds... you will never want to leave. We ate at the hotels restaurant, the Dockside as well as a few others on the island. We liked the restaurant and cannot wait to come back again to see their finished patio. Over all very impressed.. We will definately come back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice if planning an event at Granville Island Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tdub_vancouver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a bad experience at GIH. We held our wedding reception at the Hotel's lounge and found that we were overall very disappointed. The location is great, the waitstaff good and the food ok. However, if problems arise, as they did on our night, do not expect the manage to be of any help. I would not recommend this to my friends or family. Think twice if you are going to plan an event there, or at least go in warned!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great view, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ispeakcanadian
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. The location is cool in that you're in the only hotel on the Island, everyone knows where to find it, and it's central in the city. The hotel itself is reasonably priced, has very open meeting rooms with doors directly outside. The rooms are VERY clean (very), and the bathrooms are quite luxurious. The one drawback is that it's not that well insulated, sound-wise. I could hear the seagulls in the morning, and if there's a party in the hotel, you might want to bring earplugs if you're a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Great surroundings”
Reviews.Author: ELLCranbrook
Reviews.Content: Being on Granville Island and the Emily Carr College gives it a really artsy feel. We had a suite on the third floor with offered wrap around views of False Creek. You need to upgrade to a suite to really have that spacious feel. The beds were very nice, it was only the carpets that were a little worn and took away from the renovated feel.

Reviews.Title: “Granville Island Hotel - OK, but....”
Reviews.Author: piet10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after all the rave reviews. There are many pluses for this hotel, but a few caveats: . The rooms are small and sparsely furnished. There is no easy chair. . Do not hire a car and try to park it here. Granville Island is very busy, & I frequently could not find hotel parking. The daily parking charge is $12. . The V-shaped hotel has its restaurant and bar seating within the V, making for noisy evenings in your room. . The hotel restaurant merits only 3*, with slightly above average food (also expensive) . Their Microbrewery is much praised. I disagree: the beers are lightweight. However the hotel is very nice, and the staff very helpful. Being on Granville Island is a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: RoseNZ
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights on my own and wish it had been longer. I chose the Granville Island Hotel on the basis of a review on Trip Advisor from a woman who spent several Christmases there on her own with a dog. I was touched by her story. The hotel more than lived up to the story. Staff were friendly, the room luxurious and clean, with a view of the water. The food in the restaurant was creative and tasty, especially when eaten outside on their patio by the Marina. The microbrewery at the heart of the hotel gives it a unique quality that many other high end hotels lack. The beer they make is delicious, even to a woman's palate. I met the brewer in the hotel lift and was entertained by his tales of the brewing process. The Granville Island community is quaint and a lovely mix of operating businesses around the marina and tourist shops. The coffee and Red Cappuccino (rooibos tea) in the organic coffee shop are excellent. The public market with its overflowing stalls with a vast range local food is a treat in itself. Try the apple pie at the Pie shop. I took a long walk by the shore back to the hotel from the Maritime Museum and enjoyed the Vancouver skyline. Everything is accessible from Granville Island, which nestles under two flyovers.creating a little island of pleasure. Its a delightful world in an elegant city and I plan to go back. Its worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing place and good for pets”
Reviews.Author: pbfarfallina
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a wonderful central location in Vancouver. They are pet-friendly and welcomed our rather large dog (for a fee of $25 per night), even though it seemed that the other dogs that were staying there were small. The restaurant on the ground floor has good food and a great view, but is pricey. We liked the modern rooms with the tile floor, which was nice because the weather was hot the weekend we came. Our room even had a large balcony. One problem we had is our room heated up terribly, and the window air conditioner didn't make much of a dent in cooling it. The personnel provided a fan to supplement the air conditioner, which helped. We would likely come back to this place, but next time we would make sure to get a room on the side that doesn't get the afternoon sun.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Staff, Typical Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: worldgypse
Reviews.Content: Stayed on night. Room very typical, clean, nice linens, air conditioning unit under window and noisey (again Typical). Somewhat pricey for type of room (your paying for the location). Parking is extra fee. One night is enough for the area

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: paulfh
Reviews.Content: Great location, very helpful but not over fussy staff and excellent restaurant with wonderful views. Ask for a room with a water view. Its not cheap but it is very good. We went to the public market most days for breafast,

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in an Excellent Central Location”
Reviews.Author: NoWorries81
Reviews.Content: We splurged when we stayed here and it was worth every penny. What can we say, with the great location, ambiance and first class staff , who met our every need. The Dockside Restaurant, with the large aquarium and with the in-house Dockside Brewing Company (the beer is good), offered a really enjoyable tasty meal. Our room was most comfortable and with its amenities, left nothing to be desired This is simply a first class hotel. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “For the Location”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRican
Reviews.Content: A hotel with its own brewery, how can you go wrong? Seriously, we go to Vancouver BC at least once a year and have been staying at the Granville Island Hotel for the past four years. The top reason we continue to choose this hotel is its location. We love Granville Island and everything it has to offer--the botique shops, public market, restaurants, theaters, and its central location in Vancouver. We reserved a room with the internet special price of $135 CN through the hotel's web site. Our room was clean and comfortable with a king-size bed. The hotel's lobby was undergoing renovations at the time but it never created any issues with our stay. In fact, I'm anxious to see how it looks the next time we stay. We're the sort of travelers who aren't interested in luxury and a lot of amenities with our accommodations. We use hotels to sleep and shower when we're on vacation. We value location and a clean and comfortable place to stay. If you're that sort of traveler, too, this hotel is a great option for your trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Five of last six Christmases at Granville Island Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cassarooni
Reviews.Content: In 2004 my daughter was back East with her dad's family for Christmas and I just couldn't stomach the idea of spending another holiday with my then-significant other's nice but guarded family in an overheated home where conversation never goes deeper than discussion of recipes, jobs and weather. So I declared that I was taking the dog and going away for the holiday. My then-love was invited, of course, but he decided to stay home and fulfill his obligation to his family of origin. We had shared a home for over 6 years at this point, so the loyalty to family surprised me a bit but I got over it at this lovely get-away. I discovered the fantastic European-influenced, waterfront, dog-friendly Granville Island Hotel and have been back every year for Christmas Eve through Boxing Day ever since (with one exception.) I make my reservations in August, typically. I arrive early in the day on Christmas Eve to be sure to have plenty of time for the market and other fun shops on the island before they close for the holiday. It's such a wonderful experience! The staff has always been really great -- and I especially love their friendliness and sometimes cheeky humor (or maybe I love that they put up with mine.) I've stayed in a number of different rooms and though I have my favorite I have been quite comfortable in each and every one of them. The marble tile floors in the rooms make for easy management of the pet-friendly policy, so I don't mark this hotel down for that as some other reviewers have mentioned. I love having the restaurant (with their own brewery!) right on the property and have had several dinners there. Last year (2007) was the first time I tried the Christmas-morning brunch. What a treat!! It was amazing! They served everything from made-to-order Eggs Benedict to fruit and pastries to salmon and bacon and fresh-made waffles and... When the holiday routine takes it toll, take your break at the Granville. I'll see you dockside. -Elaine

Reviews.Title: “Great Location: Shops, water, views, walks, pond, brewery, arts”
Reviews.Author: LindaRan
Reviews.Content: Initially ck'd into tiny dark room - no way! Got room twice the sz with a balcony & view - MUCH better :-) This is close to everything,GR8 4 kids, couples, walking, hopping, coffee, food, farmer's market, easy acess to bridges, residential, ferries across water to downtown, yaletown, science world.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: RM2007QuintanaRoo
Reviews.Content: My boy friend and I booked this hotel on my way back to Mexico, we were just going to spend a night there and have a little city seeing. The Hotel is very well located but the price is extremely expensive for what you get, The rooms are too small and the bathrooms very old, there was this little smell all the time. They also charged us a very expensive fee for parking our vehicle. Next time (December) we will try the Hyatt, a little cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “great location for a wannabe 4 star with 2 star service”
Reviews.Author: meggotty
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel on Hotels.ca for two days. The hotel is in a great location but needs some serious updating, sound proofing and desk staff needs an attitude check towards guests. The floors throughout are marble with an occasional scatter rug. Our room was adequate. Kind size bed, tv, marble floors small scatter rug on either side of the bed. We could hear chairs and people moving around in the adjoining room as if it was in our room mostly because of the echoing from the marble floors. The room was in a very quiet section of the property but the noise factor was a problem because of the large space in the threshold of the door and the rooms on either side. The elevator groaned when in use which was kind of scary.The pay per view movie was not working the first night, worked the second. We were charged $12 per day for parking and in-room water. The website's info said $8 per day for parking and complimentary in- room water. The desk staff would not look up on Hotels.ca the discrepancies we sited when checking out but they were very cheery and smiling the whole time while denying our information which was infuriating! In this day with gas prices so high and people not traveling as much, they seriously need a reality check or else this place will close down because of all the negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Bombonero
Reviews.Content: Bad surprise: I found bedbugs in my room, or more accurately on my skin after the first night. The room was hot, humid, with a bad smell and I aksed a refound that was accepted by the desk. Result: not a very good souvenir...

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lmnparade
Reviews.Content: My husband and I pored over hotels to choose one for our honeymoon. We finally settled on a penthouse suite here and absolutely could not have been more pleased. We LOVED this place! ALL of the staff we came into contact with were welcoming, friendly, and went above and beyond to be helpful. They drew us a map to the airport at 5am and even went so far as to help me arrange secret surprises for my husband's birthday and sneakily orchestrate them! In all the service we encountered even the smallest details were attended to. The location is FANTASTIC for anyone who wants to be close to downtown but not right in the middle of the busy traffic and challenging parking. The wonderful public market and numerous restaurants and shops are just a quick walk away, as are the ferries that take you to other parts of Vancouver. You can make a longer walk to Vanier Park and an even longer walk/easy drive to Kitsilano. Downtown is an easy drive. You can also easily walk, drive, or ferry to some of the extensive walking/biking pathways around the city. We paid $12 a day for the extended stay parking pass and never once had trouble finding a spot next to the hotel. I thought the penthouse was well worth the money for a romantic stay compared to the other hotels we considered. The balcony had impressive views and was private, the suite was huge and very comfortable. The pillows and bed were amazing; we slept better than ever! They put new fresh flowers in the room every few days. If we ever come back to Vancouver, we would not consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay”
Reviews.Author: ArwenStAlbans
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and its location. Staying in an executive room with a seating area and a sleeping area, we had the most enjoyable stay. The water view was terrific. Could not fault the staff and would stay there again if we return at any time to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: TorontoFrequentrvlr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice now; the first visit was a few years ago and the room we got was amazing, with great views of False Creek and the water. Service seemed fine enough then, although we had no reason to really deal with them. The second time I stayed there was a marked contrast -- so much so that I'm not sure I want to stay there again. We requested a king, but were booked into a room with two double beds, overlooking a boardwalk so we couldn't open our curtains. When we saw a couple check out, we asked if we could be switched to their room instead (we were just there for one night) and were told the same "sorry, we are fully booked." I don't quibble with hotel management since I'm sure they have reasons for doing things the way they do, but I don't like being lied to. Some kind of simple explanation would have satisfied us instead of a template response. When we were leaving to go the airport, we asked for a cab, to be met with the response, "oh, there are always cabs outside." After waiting 10 minutes outside to no avail, we decided to hoof it to the nearby cab stand. Amazing that the hotel staff couldn't even be bothered to call for a cab on a quiet early Saturday morning. When we stored our bags in the hotel's baggage area, one of the bags' handles was damaged when it was returned to us. After the annoyance of being treated rather shabbily we decided to forego complaining, cut our losses and learn from this experience. What a shame. Fortunately, Granville Island and Vancouver as usual did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Sub Par Hotel for us”
Reviews.Author: esperansi
Reviews.Content: The room was so tiny we could hardly fit in it. No carpet on the floor, hardly any outlets and the bathroom was too small. We requested a larger room, since we were a group of three, previously booked and wanting an adequate room. We were told none were available. The room was small and dark and old. In no way was this a three star hotel. We left that night for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: Rolsma
Reviews.Content: We asked for one night, but after having a fantasticevening and night in a splendid room we wanted to extend our stay with one extra night. This caused a lot of problems.. We had to leave the room, but they would probably find another room for us. This took ages, we had to return to the hotel a few times and at the end found out there was no room. After a long conversation we could get some sort of spare room. This was a strange room directly next to some sort of congress room. The prices were ok, the first night splendid. Help at front desk not good en second night not so good. Overall average, what simpley could have been Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We love Granville Island”
Reviews.Author: ROSIEW
Reviews.Content: We last stayed here 4 years ago and really loved the location. It's near enough to the city yet has a different feel - probably because the Island is a working place, not just a tourist trap. The market itself is so interesting and the food is wonderful. It's also great to see the students at the Emily Carr Institute. The hotel is really nice and the staff are friendly and helpful. We had to change our itinerary beforehand, so could only have a standard room for the first night and then a king suite for the following 2 nights. The standard room was very good, on the ground floor overlooking the patio area, and we would have happily stayed there if the king suite had been unavailable. However, we really wanted a room on the 2nd floor with a view over False creek, so changed on night 2. Our only real disappontment was when we walked around Gastown, which really seems to have got shabby since our last visit. There are far more people begging and the whole area is in need of some upgrading. For old times sake, we even had lunch at the Old Spaghetti Factory, but the food wasn't very good, so we decided to give the city a miss and pootle around the Island instead .

Reviews.Title: “Not a place for late nights”
Reviews.Author: newgrange
Reviews.Content: Perhaps people in Canada just go to bed very early, I don't know, but you would think a hotel that caters almost exclusively for holiday makers would have come across people who liked to have a drink after a day's sightseeing. I was part of a group of fifteen, all staying a minimum of five nights in this hotel - the hotel itself was fine, but their attitude to us when we requested a drink at 10.30pm (hardly the middle of the night) was not exactly welcoming - in fact one night it was suggested we go to another establishment on the island. They were happy enough to take a large amount of money from us for our accommodation and meal costs, but it was too much trouble to serve us one drink at half ten? Now in case you think we were a group of lager louts, we were almost all women, with an average age of about 40 - we were unlikely to start wrecking the place or puking in the corridors. We wanted one or maybe two quiet drinks before bed and it was quite irritating to be made feel so unwelcome. The rooms in the hotel were lovely. In general the staff were most accommodating, but to be made feel like some sort of rowdy alco for wanting a glass of wine at night was most unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Dated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adam R
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't be in a better location. Granville Island is a wonderful attraction for visitors and locals. In addition to the large market, there is also a kids market, shops, water taxis, theatre, art school and other attractions for people of all ages. It's also a lovely place to sit and watch the world go by. The hotel on the other hand was probably great when it opened, but is definitely showing its age. An example of this is the bidet in the bathroom which was badly cracked and only provided cold water - yikes! My room had a small balcony but the sliding glass door needed repairing and was quite difficult to open and close. The staff were quite friendly and helpful but couldn't compensate for a location that is badly in need of updating. If you're the kind of person who likes to lounge around in your room, this isn't really a spectacular place; but if it's just a bed to you and you're more likely to be out often, it would be ok - but just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly the Location”
Reviews.Author: Canucks07
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel primarily because of its location, value, and it is close to downtown. The biggest obivious attraction of this hotel is its location - smack dab in the middle of Granville Island, and therefore close to the restaurants, markets, shops, and galleries that are all nearby. Like, I mean, within a couple of city blocks. And on the water, the ships gliding by, the water taxis, the sailboats, the seagulls, and the smells of the sea, all at your doorstep. And the hotel is a $10 cab ride from downtown or you can take a water taxi to the edge of the downtown area. Otherwise, it is kind of a humble little hotel. Small personal feel to it. Very accomodating, offering the use of their umbrellas (take one!), pointing out attractions, giving you maps, friendly greetings every day. Friendly and informal. Attached to the hotel is a great little patio restaurant by the water's edge (when weather permits) and a bar/restaurant inside with a mico-brewery. The food is acceptable, but don't expect gourmet. But don't fret, you are in Vancouver, where a new restaurant is born every week. Easy to park your car right in the lot in front of the hotel or the hotel staff will even volunteer to park it for you. The rooms themselves are spacious, we had a king-size bed, with a little balcony that looked out towards downtown. Otherwise, the decor and furnishings are a little tired and dated. It is clean, just a little frumpy. Nothing a little renovation couldn't quickly take care of. Like the wonky shower head. So if the hotel itself is real important and you intend to spend alot of time in the room itself, I don't recommend this hotel to you. But if you spend very little time in the hotel, as we generally do, then it is just OK and sometimes even better than just OK when you look at the lights of downtown at night over the water.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 25th Wedding Anniversary Choice”
Reviews.Author: SuePhoenix
Reviews.Content: After two nights in Whistler, my husband and I checked into the Granville Island Hotel and couldn't have been more thrilled with the room. That said, we DID splurge and got the executive suite for approx. $265/night. However, the room was clean, very large, and the marina view with sparkling water & skyline at night was perfect. The Granville is located out of the big city, and has its own unique feel. The water taxis were fun to just go for a ride on. I loved staying on the island, although I am not sure if I would have been so excited about the hotel if I was in a standard room looking out to a parking lot/huge crane. We ate on the island ~ upstairs at Bridges Restaurant and found the food pricey but very tasty. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant and although convenient, the food was marginal and not worth the high price. Two coffees, one muffin and one bagel w/cream cheese the next morning at the open air market was much better and fun. Renting bikes and riding around Stanley Park is a MUST. Also enjoyed the suspension bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gwelly
Reviews.Content: Great location. Rooms fine and generally clean and tidy. Would recommend the hotel due to it's proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Granville Island Hotel in the rain”
Reviews.Author: MarinMom
Reviews.Content: The Granville Island Hotel is a great little place to stay if you don't want the big city experience, and you like walking out your door to the marketplace, coffee shops, galleries and outdoor spaces that surround you on this interesting island. We often visit Vancouver to see family, and decided to stay someplace different. We love going to Granville Island, but never have enough time to explore all of the nooks and crannies of this interesting place. The hotel is showing some signs of age, but the truly wonderful restaurant, cheery staff, and easy access to the city make this a hotel that every Vancouver visitor should try at least once. It rained all four days that we were there in mid-July, which is fairly unusual for this time of year. As they say there "No worries", because you could duck in and out of the little shops and galleries without getting too wet, and when a real downpour came as we were dressed up and heading into the city, we were offered a huge umbrella by the staff, which we kept until check out. Please do try the restaurant. The food was superb, and the atmosphere is wonderful - right on the water. We heard from friends that it is really wonderful when you can sit outside. Also, there is a brewery on site, and some of the beers were great. Maybe do a taste test first. So, I would recommend this hotel for its unique location and friendly staff. The bed was quite comfortable, but the A/C a bit noisy. No worries....

Reviews.Title: “granville iosland inn o.k.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaRobert
Reviews.Content: Hotel is O.K. but way overpriced. Staff were courteous. Room was clean although we did find the in room coffee maker to be dirty and as a consequence did not have coffee in the room. Staff did provide free coffee to take with us when we complained. The island and the hotel are tourist traps and have very little to offer unless you like going to the market on the island which again was merely o.k. If you are driving, my suggestion is to stay at the Vancouver Metrotown Hilton . Great hotel, good value for the money ( saved $ 80.00 a night compared to granville island hotel) close to largest shopping mall in Canada, free self parking when staying at the property.(paid $12.00 at granville.) courteous and friendly staff . Very clean rooms. Will return if visiting Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Granville Island”
Reviews.Author: SuperLull
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 2 nights at the Granville Island Hotel as part of a 5 night trip to Vancouver. I lchose this hotel for its unique location - on the water, near the market and near the Kitsilano neighborhood. We arrived late on our first night and were happy to find the lively Sand Bar restaurant for a tasty fish dinner. I went for a couple fantastic runs each morning from the hotel, west along the water and into Jericho Park. It was nice to have the public market so close, for breakfast pastries and coffee. We didn't eat in the hotel, so I can't comment on the restaurant, but after dinner one night we sat outside on the restaurant terrace, which was really nice and relaxing. Our room was a bit small, but not terribly so. It was reasonably clean, but showed its age, for sure. Service (front desk and housekeeping) was not outstanding, but completely satisfactory. All in all, I think the rooms are a bit over-priced, but I'm not too disappointed, considering the location. I was happy to have 2 nights here, then move to a less expensive hotel downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: oztraveller74
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in August 06 and was impressed from the 1st minute of my arrival. Having just come off a very long flight from Australia I arrived well before regular check in time but was shown to my room straight away. Very pretty outlook over the harbour. Good points: Very welcoming atmosphere Room was very clean & well appointed Room service was promt & food was great same as restaurant Best Mini bar selection of my whole trip lots of local treats Very close to the great Granville Island Markets (1-2 min walk) Very good service from all staff Close to Aquabus which takes you into downtown Vancouver (a bit of a hike uphill to get into town) Free internet access for guests there is one computer in lobby so you somtimes have to wait for another guest to finish but it is rare to find free access The Beer brewed on site was pretty good Disappointing points: Was not on the pick up list for day trips but it is very quick & cheap trip into Vancouver to meet up with a trip. The Big Bus hop onhop off goes fairly close to the hotel (5-7 min walk) Live Music played most nights from Restaurant which while very good when you have a full day and want to sleep it would go until about midnight. Would recommend to any traveller

Reviews.Title: “Awsome stay during Christmas”
Reviews.Author: DowneyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome experience. We arrived a little late on Xmas day after a troublesome time with the car rental company (Budget did not have a car for me despite having a valid reservation). The hotel staff was friendly and upgraded me to the penthouse. The room had outstanding views. My kids thought they were in heaven with such a large suite. We had our Xmas dinner at the hotel and even though it was a little pricey, we had a nice dinner. The desserts were outstanding as well as the service. The best part of the hotel is being able to walk to the Public Market where you can find everything you need to prepare a wonderful meal (like a picnic with wine, cheese, bread, fruits, meats, etc) or you could just eat at the many food stalls. We had a car, so we were able to drive to many places in Vancouver like Stanley Park, Canada Place, Chinatown, Robson Street, Yaletown, etc. My wife and I truly enjoyed our stay and we love the atmosphere of the public market.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All”
Reviews.Author: BlaiseCrosby
Reviews.Content: We loved the scenic views and the location--specifically, ample food, drink, and dining options within walking distance, and a 5-10 minute drive to downtown via the Burrard Bridge. A daily CAD$8 parking fee is charged. You get a pass which allows you unlimited parking at any (legal) spot on the island. Parking is a challenge, and so is traffic. Agree that the hotel itself is nothing wonderful. Rooms are on the small side. Liked the "Lord & Mayfair" toiletries and the larger bathtub. Disliked the cold tiled floors in the room, but there are two runner rugs provided. Did not notice any unpleasant odors. The thermostat in the room did not work. The restaurant hostess was reluctant to seat us in the main dining area when we said we were only having dessert and appetizers (I don't know what the deal was as it was 9pm, well past peak hour). We got seated in a rather noisy lounge, which we left; we were then seated in the main dining area upon request. Great view of the marina. The front desk staff was adequate, didn't think they were noticeably friendly or otherwise. Getting to downtown Vancouver (and the hotel) is marred by a jarring lack of freeway access. Not even a limited access divided highway. Completely unlike Toronto and our American friends. Only stay here is you intend to visit downtown alot and love Granville Island. Overall, we were pleased by our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Annji
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Granville Island Hotel for one night in late September prior to embarking on a cruise. The hotel was well appointed, our room comfortable and decorated in a traditional style. The size was adequate for us -- as we do not spend a lot time in a hotel, preferring to see the city instead. There was a small balcony and we could see the water and boats both from our window and the balcony. The room was quiet and we did not notice any noise from "neighbors". The bath included a bidet. The staff at the hotel were very friendly, helpful and cheerful. When we checked out they gladly kept our luggage until we were ready to leave the "island". As it was misty and a bit rainy that day they offered us the use of an umbrella which made our walk around the area much more pleasant. We also noticed that the restaurant staff and bar staff went out of their way to be helpful and offer just a bit extra. One note for those seeking taxi's - I do not believe it is possible to just "hail" a taxi while walking about. The Hotel ordered one for us and it arrived well within the time frame given -- 5-10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on!”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyAnnS
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel and particularly helpful and accommodating staff. The room we stayed in had a superb view over the marina at the back of the hotel. The bed was huge and the room a good size. We has breakfast at the hotel twice. There are a variety of options at a reasonable price. The location, although not downtown, was still great. It's actually a good thing that we weren't in the centre. Granville Island itself has restuarants of its own, a wonderful public market and quaint boutiques. It was very easy to travel around Vancouver from here. A short seabus trip across to Hornby Street took us to downtown for $2.50pp. All the major sight-seeing bus tours stop just a couple of minutes walk away as does public transport. The staff were happy to advise us on whale whatching trips, transport options and tours. They went out of their way to call up on our behalf and accommodate us in any way possible. There is free internet access which is a great bonus. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff we encountered”
Reviews.Author: mazdauk
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the last 4 nights of our 2-week holiday and were not disappointed. The staff welcomed us with great warmth and throughout our stay were genuinely pleased to offer help and advice on topics such as buses (including whether it was better to walk or take the ferry). Our room was on the ground floor, and I was initially worried it might be noisy as it had a view of the waiter's water station for the outside patio, but in fact it was very quiet, and we could glimpse the water through the shrubs which preserved our privacy, as well as people-watching. We had a room with 2 double beds for my husband and myself and our two boys (12 and 6), and the space was comfortable (though not generous) for the 4 of us, even when returning to the room for some "down time". Granville Island itself is fascinating - I could spend a fortune in the market, and the Kids Market is good for clothes and shoes as well as toys. The Dockside Restaurant in the hotel is superb, and we ended up eating there twice for dinner. Didn't try the breakfast we we tended to buy things from the market and eat them outside. If you're staying over a weekend I recommend booking for dinner as it was packed on Saturday night and Sunday lunchtime. A relaxed and comfortable place for families or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: MGods
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Granville Island Hotel during our recent trip around BC and would have to say that we were disappointed. We had booked a ‘standard room’ and were initially placed in a room at the back of the hotel in desperate need of refurbishment with a cold tiled floor which was truly awful (especially after a long flight from the UK). We therefore asked to be moved and the next day were moved to another room facing the water (albeit with no balcony) and although considerably better than the first room it was still nothing special as well as being fairly small and we certainly didn’t feel it was worth the price paid. In a in our opinion the hotel is definitely overpriced for what if offers, but unfortunately it has no competition and probably the best location in Vancouver. Despite all the negatives we would definitely stay there again should we return to Vancouver and would recommend it to anyone purely because of the location. Granville Island is a wonderful place to stay with a good choice of restaurants as well as the Public Market which is fantastic, and all set in a friendly, relaxed, water front environment within a 5 minute stroll of the Hotel. Downtown, Robson Street, and Stanley Park are all easy to reach with a 10 / 15 minute bus ride, but better still take the water bus across the creek and walk as nothing is very far apart. Then at the end of the day return to the tranquillity of Granville Island for a cold beer (two breweries on the island!) and a nice meal sat beside the water watching the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: BuryBigS
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop of a two week vacation in Canada. The front desk staff were very friendly and welcoming after our long flight. Having read reviews that the rooms are small, I was surprised to find that our room was huge! It was ground floor so looked out onto the car park, but this was a small price to pay for the space we had. The breakfasts at the hotel were one of our favourite memories of Vancouver. They were superb and very reasonably priced. The hotel's location is off the beaten track, but all the usual tourist buses stop just a stones throw from the hotel so getting around wasn't a problem. There was internet access for guets in the main foyer, and our room had a huge tv. The only downfall we could find was that we were regularly woken in the night by guests returning to their rooms. This was mostly due to the fact that our room was on the ground floor and close to the conference areas where most delegates would have been staying. Having said that we would definitely return. The setting is beautiful, right on the marina, the staff were fantastic, and the food was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: BruceScotland
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with really nice staff and is a beautiful place to go for a drink or to stay. We arrived after a 9 hour flight from London on our honeymoon and thanks to our bestman the hotel knew about this and upgraded us.Then later in the evening the booking for the penthouse was cancelled, and guy at the desk asked if we would like to move. This was more than considerate and made for a wonderful first night. Apart from the special treatment that we recieved we found all the people who worked there to be really nice and interested in having a conversation. This is a very well set up hotel. The views of South Downtown are amazing (see pics).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mayarimom
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. When we initially entered our room it became clear that animals had stayed in the room -- husband and son have bad animal allergies -- they moved us to another room. The rooms are incredibly small. They need to update the place, but since it is the only hotel on Granville Island I think they are in no rush! The location is excellent and they give you a parking permit to park on the island (normally there is a 3 hour maximum). We never had a problem parking the car even though the island gets very busy on the weekends. The hotel restaurant was fine, not great. The second room we were in had a view of the water which made it more bearable. The Staff was very friendly and helpful. There was a fire alarm at 11pm (had kids in bed!) and it was unclear as to whether we should evacuate. They told us they thought it was a false alarm...Granville Island is a great place to visit w/kids - lots to do and a fun water park.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably nice, unique location”
Reviews.Author: Shobusun
Reviews.Content: From reading other reviews, my expectations for this hotel were high and honestly I was a little disappointed. My girlfriend and I didn't get the best room- we were on the first floor, with our window facing the outside restaurant seating, which felt a bit intrusive and uncomfortable. If possible, try to get an upstairs (second floor of this two story hotel) room. Being on Granville Island makes the hotel unique and distinctive- but not quite spectacular. What it does provide is a sense of seclusion or reprieve from downtown Vancouver, while still remaining accessible to it. Getting to downtown you'll have to get a cab, catch a bus (5-10 minute walk) or jump on a little aqua bus (boat) to traverse the waterway between the hotel and downtown. If you've got kids, this is great place to stay- there's lots of places and fun things to do for kids on Granville Island. Arts and crafts enthusiasts will feel right at home too. On a plaintive note, the island is a bit "touristy" and somewhat busy with traffic. There's a concrete mixing plant located about 200 yards from the hotel as well, complete with a large fleet of mixing trucks, which I found a bit odd, but not to worry- it's not something you really notice until you actually walk by it.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location!”
Reviews.Author: LADWhitePlains
Reviews.Content: After studying tripadvisor for some time we decided to make the best of our single-night stay in Vancouver by booking the Granville Island Hotel and we were not let down. The hotel is located as close to the water as you can get without falling in. Its a bit old and some of the furnishings and fabrics in the room showed their age, but its clean and quiet and the mattress was comfortable. All the rooms have some view of the water and although they are small and expensive it is worth it. The valet will help you find a spot for your car and the hotel gives you the required window permit that will allow your car to remain parked for more than the 3 hours the law allows. Parking on Granville Island is hard but once you park you certainly do not need your car again on the Island and you can easily grab a jitney boat that will take across the water to downtown Vancouver in a matter of minutes. The restuarant in the hotel is quite nice and despite its "brewery" designation is much more of a full menu than you might expect. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: varroom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fabulous location - right on the water, central to everything in Vancouver and right in the middle of a quaint and picturesque area. We had a wonderful view of the water traffic in the day and the skyline at night. The "island" has a large market with good food at reasonable prices and the hotel restaurant is top notch. The staff was friendly, room service prompt and the free internet in the lobby was a help. This hotel is not a luxury 5-star resort type hotel but we would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for an interesting and central place to stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...but they allow pets...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this hotel! Its perfect to be near the water and located in one of the greatest areas in Vancouver. I checked in no problem and they gave us a room they was sort of facing the water. Meaning you had to go out on to the balcony and look to your right to see water. The room also had a weird smell. I checked their website and discovered they allow pets, which explains the tile room in that room. I'm assuming the previous occupant was a negligent pet owner and allowed their pet to do their business everywhere in the room. We asked for another room right away and managed to get something that was equivalent to the one we had. I'm guessing that was fortunate since it was Easter and a conference was coming in a few days. The good stuff: the rooms are clean and tidy. The restaurant on the ground floor is excellent. The room service was great! Didn't try out the pool. Most of the staff was friendly. It was convienient to grab breakfast from the Granville Market and the restaurants in Granville are excellent. We went to the Pacific Culinary Institute and that was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT Little Hotel! - Nice, Cozy, and great beer!”
Reviews.Author: thumper24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just concluded our 4 day stay at this hotel and loved every minute of it. I just read the review below and was left a bit puzzled. If you're looking to stay at a big hi-rise in the middle of the hustle and bustle of downtown, then this place is not for you. If you're looking for a smaller (decent sized) hotel with a relaxed environment (not to mention romantic), and is a 3 minute drive (5 minute water taxi ride) from downtown Vancouver, then this IS the hotel for you. Granville Island is actually a little peninsula (more like a giant pier) with a very laid back feel to it, complete with a down-home fresh foods market, like something you would see in the movies. There are several shops and plenty of excellent places to eat FRESH seafood, including the Dockside Restaurant and pub (microbrew). The hotel is right on the water (harbor) with a direct view of the hi-rises of Vancouver. There is plenty of pathway to take a romantic walk around the island (on the water) and to observe water traffic. The hotel itself is pretty up-to-date (complete with Internet access) and the staff is very nice and extremely helpful. We stayed in an executive suite, which had a separate living room, and was facing the water and downtown Vancouver... an excellent view. If you're going to stay for more than one night, I would highly recommend spending the extra few bucks for the upgrade. I've stayed in all types, all ratings of hotels around the world and I rank Granville Island Hotel as one of my top picks due to the location and relaxed environment... especially for an adult getaway.

Reviews.Title: “4th rated hotel on Tripadvisor?”
Reviews.Author: sheds
