Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Granville Island Hotel on 25th May 2006. We had chosen it based on the reviews on the Trip advisor web site. We just wanted some where to stay for one night before we began our tour of Britsivh Columbia. It was OK for this purpose. Just somewhere to sleep. I cannot understand it's high rating on this site. It was very tight on space for 2 adults and 2 adolescents and a little past its prime. Granville Island market is a great place for breakfast, but I would suggest that if your stay is for more than one night, you choose another hotel. We stayed in 6 hotels in all and this was by no means the cheapest, but it was the least appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Small”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here, for a weekend, based on trip advisor recommendations. The overall standard is good especially cleanliness and service. The location is very good being very close to downtown and most city attractions. Granville Island is captivating with its arts, crafts, music and market!! Beautiful scenes abound. The only drawback could be room size as ours was only just adequate and the view was rather restricted. But we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: young7898
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel. Room was quite small, with very limited closet space, especially for 2 adults and a child. Free hi-speed internet was very welcome. The restaurant is excellent, and good value if you take advantage of the $25 three-course special. The beer brewed on the premises was also very good. One of the drawbacks of staying on Granville Island is the parking - almost impossible at the weekend, even after paying the hotel $7 for a pass that allows you to park beyond the normal 3 hour limit. All in all, if I had to return to Vancouver I would think about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: DATE: October 21, 2005; October 28-30, 2005 Initially stayed for one night at the Granville Island Hotel when we first arrived in Vancouver. Drove to Whistler and spent a week there. Returning to Vancouver we returned to the Granville Island Hotel for the remainder of our trip. We found this charming hotel to be more than we anticipated. The staff was consistently warm and friendly and above all very servicing. The rooms in the section away from the Front Desk by the banquet rooms seemed larger than those in the wing closer to the Front Desk. The bathrooms in the newer section had more counter space to place personal toiletries. That aside, the rooms were very clean and provided all the amenities needed to help make our stay quite comfortable. Hairdryers were provided along with lighted magnifying make-up mirrors (we found in the larger rooms). The mini bar was stocked sufficiently with a wide variety of refreshments and snacks. The Front Desk staff went out of their way to provide excellent directions along with helpful driving tips. The Dockside Restaurant has a beautiful view of the waterfront and the ambiance was warm and contemporary. The food and service were outstanding. What a great plus to have a class-act restaurant located within the hotel. Loved how this hotel is centrally located within Granville Island which made it convenient to walk to nearby art galleries, restaurants, shops and the famous Public Market. Driving to Yaletown, North Vancouver, Stanley Park and other surrounding attractions/destinations made it easy. The computer and printer located in the lobby for guests to use was very helpful. We used it mainly to obtain addresses and directions via Yahoo! or Google Map and simply printed the directions. Another plus was the complimentary high-speed internet access in all the rooms. Whenever we travel, my husband and I bring our laptop and check our emails daily. This also allowed us to research events and activities and various places to visit for the following day. We will DEFINITELY return to the Granville Island Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grandville Island Hotel--Upgraded to a Suite!”
Reviews.Author: IrishSapphireGirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a rainy Thursday day to be greeted by a very friendly staff. We were told that we had been upgraded to a suite. It was a very nice room with a beautiful view of the waterfront. In one part of the room, we could lay on the sofa watching television while we watched the world passing by through the large window. In the other part of the room, we could sleep or just have breakfast in bed while watching the other television in the room. The Dockside Restaurant was very good. We enjoyed a good lunch. And then we wandered around the shops of Granville Island. I especially enjoyed the Public Market. I found the best gift for my friend at the Okanagan Wine Shop. It was a bottle of wine with a miniature tuxedo jacket around the bottle. Later that night, we went back to the Dockside restaurant for dinner. We shared a steak in a beautiful setting of a table of two with a good view of the waterfront and a candle on the table. Overall, it was a romantic Thursday night at the Granville Island Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Granille Island Hotel”
Reviews.Author: catriona2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the basis of the tripadvisor reviews and it exceeded expectations. Our room was fantastic, especially for the price paid. It was huge, comfortable ,clean, nicely decorated and with great views over the boats of False Creek. All staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. Generally this hotel has excellent service, is fantastic value, the restaurant is good with great views, but the best thing is that it just has a lovely relaxed and friendly atmosphere. The location is just perfect. I was so glad that we hadn't booked one of the bigger, high rise downtown hotels. My family consists of myself, my husband and our 8 year old son.In total we were in Vancouver for about 6 days and we never needed to take a bus or taxi during our whole trip other than the Aquabus to/from Granville Island. That took us to downtown, Yaletown, the Science centre, the Space museum... and then we just walked. But it was great actually being based on Granville Island. The food market made me wish I was cooking and not eating out at restaurants! Also with the theatres, great restaurants , the artists studios/shops, the microbreweries etc it's a brilliant area . I would definately recommend the hotel and the area to anyone planning a trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marblecat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband on the first leg of our honeymoon and it was one of the best hotels we stayed in (and far better value than others!). The staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfasts were the best we had throughout our trip and the views across the Vancouver were stunning. Our room was very spacious (bathroom was probably on the small side given the room size but not a concern for us). Granville Island was great. Glad we stayed here rather than in the busy city centre, the market really is something! Would definitely recommend a return visit. The only downside was that when booking I mentioned it was our honeymoon however there was no mention of congratulations on arrival which I believe is good customer service but otherwise we could not fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: Broken_Foot_Mama
Reviews.Content: After spending our first night (of a two-night trip) at the Sylvia Hotel in the West End, we were afraid that this hotel would also disappoint...we shouldn't have worried! The Granville Island Hotel was an absolute delight from start to finish. We are not accomplished travelers, so it was very helpful to have such a patient desk and valet staff. The hotel itself is lovely inside and has an enchanting location...you wind your way through Granville Island to the end, and end up at this little gem of a hotel. I will say that our room was small, but so delightful that it just didn't matter. The furnishings were nice, everything was clean and unworn, and the shutters on the windows were charming! The view from our second-story room was great - looking out over the boats on False Creek. The bathroom seemed large to us and the tub was great! All rooms come with a free paper, self-serve coffee in the room and high-speed internet access (a godsend!). The restaurant was stunning as well...I had a great creme brulee later in the evening, looking out at the lights across the creek. We will definitely go back and I would recommend this place without hestitation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trip on the Bride!”
Reviews.Author: IndiaWith4Kids
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and obviously a favorite with discerning locals having events...they weren't really an obstruction to our having a great time, but did become something of a joke as both the hotel and adjoining park/marina/galleries are dripping with wedding parties. We had a great room at the end of the hall with a king size bed, and a connecting door to a smaller room with two doubles. The end room is great because even though it's small, 2 walls are window-sliders to balconies overlooking ritzy boats and water traffic. Restaurant was great. Bathrooms are super-luxorious. Beds are lush. We travelled with 4 kids and still had a terrific, romantic weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Granville Island Hotel was Great”
Reviews.Author: drkmn
Reviews.Content: We felt that we really made the right choice to stay at Granville Island Hotel. The location was perfect. My two kids loved walking through the island each day to get back to the hotel. We asked for a room with a view of the water and were very happy with the beautiful view. The staff was very helpful. We had a problem with the toilet running and somebody came up to fix it immediately. Everybody was very nice and I can't say enough about the great location. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: BDSid
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first five nights of our holiday in Canada and were delighted by this little gem of a hotel. Take a stretch limo from the Airport for only Can$38 and arrive in style. Granville Island has the feel of street market, our kids loved it, forget expensive tours when the weather is good, the free water park kept them amused for hours. The Hotel itself has great views across False Creek, and you do not feel you are in a large City. Only three stories high and not overlooked. To get to the attractions take an Aquabus across False Creek Can $10 each way for the five of us and walk to Robson Street for retail therapy. then take a bus to Stanley Park, hire a bike and do the circuit of 6 miles to recover. Staff in the hotel were good, very attentive and helpful, room was on the smaller side, but did accomodate two queen beds and an adult roll-away. Excellent value for money. A great start to a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: adrianBristolUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel was all that I had hoped having read the reviews. Granville Island is a great location for exploring the markets on the Island - My kids loved the Children's market and the water park. Felt very safe for a family. Views across harbour superb. Restaurant v. good. Enjoyed the food and service was fine. Rooms not large but well equipped and very clean. Parking could be an issue since Island v popular but there is valet parking for $6. We found no need for car. We were staying for 3 nights and found bus/taxi easy. Taxi c. $20 fare to downtown. Close enough to downtown without all of the hassle from a family perspective. For bus take no 50 from outside starbucks. Goes right downtown and then through chinatown/gastown. Only warning for buses is you need exact change for fare. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse is to die for”
Reviews.Author: hairykid
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the UK tired and, hungry, and dirty, and found to our delight that we had been upgraded to a penthouse suite. The staff were very apologetic about the fire that had temporarily closed the restaurant, but when we saw our room, we forgot all about food. It was vast, with a dining room, 2 bathrooms - and a jacuzzi in the bedroom! We were so comfortable in the hotel that it was hard to leave it to join our cruise ship (where the bed was far less comfortable). The public market was amazing in the variety and quality of the food - nothing at all like the sad collection of vegetable stalls that you find at most UK town markets. The hotel staff were very helpful in getting us to and from the aquarium, giving change, arranging taxis. They really seemed to care about the guests. The hotel brought in free pastries and coffee every morning, while the restaurant was being refurbished. We ate them in the sunshine by the water, looking at the Vancouver skyline. It was pure bliss.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it - no rental car”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five nights at the Granville Island Hotel, selecting it based on reviews from this site, and we were delighted. The first night we were in a smaller room without a view, which was quite small, and upon request, they moved us the next morning to a larger room with a balcony and great view without any charges. We loved the brew pub as well. But the main high-light for us, as we are sick of being in our cars in Los Angeles, was the public transportation. We didn't want to rent a car, and this location was perfect. A cab from the airport cost around $18 US, and then the rest of the days we used the excellent public transportation system. The island itself is lovely to wander around, and each day we bought either breakfast or a picnic lunch at the market. We traveled to Gastown by bus, easily accessed at the entrance to the island, and we took a bus and then the waterbus to the suspension bridge. We actually walked home one night from the GM Center, a half-hour walk. There are plenty of paths to jog and walk around the water, and lots of choices for dinner and drinks. Very close by are two HUGE beachside public pools as well. We took a bus to Stanley Park, and then walked to the water ferry to come back to the island. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and accomodating, and we used the free internet and printer in the lobby to research the bus lines. The desk staff was also very knowledgable about getting around. The island is also super for kids with the kids market and a free water park.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldSteeler
Reviews.Content: I posted a review of this hotel last year relating our experience of this hotel and Granville Island but I was roused to return by the recent review posted by the visitor from Chesterfield UK. I am a near neighbour coming from Sheffield UK and both my wife and I and our friends who stayed last year at total variance with the opinions of our fellow Brits! The position of the hotel is superb not only for visiting Granville Island but it is also central to visiting the rest of Vancouver. None of us recognise that markets exist in the UK with the variety and quality of the public market on Granville Island (not even the excellent market at Chesterfield) and its position at the heart of a mixture of cultural and top quality restaurants produced a vibrant and stimulating atmosphere. Some friends who subsequently visited agreed wholeheartedly with what we found.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: needdm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on July 30th after reading all the good reviews of this hotel. I have to say I was disappointed with the hotel. The hotel is perfectly acceptable, but does not stand out. We stayed in room 319 which was of average size for the hotel. The room was the smallest we stayed in during our tour of western Canada, and it was a struggle to fit in a rollaway bed for my son. The rooms are fairly well equipped, and on the surface look good, however the fittings when you look closely at them are not top quality, and will not last. Parking is a problem, and you will probably need to use the valet parking available at the hotel which costs $7. I personally do not think the location is particularly good, you do get a nice view across False Creek, but the downside is that access to the city is difficult. You really are forced to use the ferry boats to get across the creek. This is an enjoyable way to reach the city, but gets expensive if there is a group of you as it costs $2.50 each way. Granville Island itself is very disappointing. Basically a food market and some specialist shops. The market may be unique in North America, but in the UK most towns and cities have a market at least as good. We also stayed at the Slyvia Hotel in the West end, next door to Stanley Park, and that was much better value, both in regard to location, and space.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was definately the best hotel in the city. It had views of the harbour and the rooms were absolutely beautiful -- nice marble floors too. The front desk will help you arrange any travel plans and are experts on the area. Staying on Granville Island you can walk to the public market every morning and you're just a bus ride into downtown.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Mrozinski
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the second time. I was so impressed by the location, staff, view and rooms on my November visit that I came back in June. This time I reserved a suite, which was a great size room with a full-on False Creek and city view. Being so near all the restaurants and the Public Market and being able to travel around the city without a car, using the AquaBus, ferries, SkyTrain, made for a great birthday vacation. The hotel restaurant is also a good place to meet with business contacts. Great jazz at the Sunday Brunch. Hated to leave. All in all, superb!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room but don't forget the clothespins for your nose”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice room, but stench of vinyl in room was overpowering - headache city. Hotel staff indifferent to guests - very uninformative. Restaurant/Lounge: Food was great; service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tribal_Leader
Reviews.Content: Booked in for a three night stay March 2005, and stayed at this hotel based purely on the reviews posted on this site. I have to say I was not disappointed, it proved to be a gem of a find in Vancouver. Location was superb, we were drawing envious looks from others when we mentioned we were staying in Granville Island. The area has a very cosmopolitan feel, and the market is excellent. The hotel is quite small by international standards, however the service was superb. Attentive staff were always willing to help. An on-site brewery is always good, however I found the prices for drinks were more expensive than downtown Vancouver. My only gripe is there is only one, quite slow lift in the hotel. However, at $130 CA per room/night, an absolute bargain.

Reviews.Title: “A great little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: -we spent a toatl of 3 nights the week of March 12 thru 19. had a king suite at a very reasonable rate with a SUPERB view to the north. -location is quiet and quaint with none of the noise and bustle of downtown, yet it is a short distance from all the action. -personnel are friendly and helpful -Dockside restaurant has excellent food and excellent service at still reasonable prices...a rarity in Vancouver where restaurants are outrageously expensive. -have travelled across Canada extensively, and this is one of the best small hotels in the country. -price-quality ratio is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Deserves a huge 5 stars. Suite was amazing with views over the false creek harbour and city skyline. Food/service was faultless. Very peacful at night and sitting by the fire in the bar prior to dinner was so relaxing. Location wise hard to beat, just a short ferry ride from town and an easy walk over bridge. Cannot wait to go back. Most comfortable week I have spent anywhere.
